28672.name: Gladius et Sarissa:  Cynoscephalae, 197 BC
28672.description: This simulation covers the Battle of Cynoscephalae, a classic battle between the Roman manipular legion and a Hellenistic force descended from the army of Alexander the Great. The battle was the result of heavy skirmishing and both sides quickly rushed reinforcements to the scene. Therefore, at the beginning of the simulation there are no fixed positions except for your skirmishers. Alternatively, you may wish to try your hand at the turning point of the battle and see if you repeat or change history. Historically, the Romans won this battle after heavy fighting but can you recreate history or will you lead the forces of Philip V to victory over Rome?

28673.name: Savana
28673.description:
Savana (in English language Savannah) is a fast, simple, family card game.
Each player is a Savannah animal. Each animal has its unique power. Each card represents one of the four animals in the game with a number value.
Every turn players discard two cards to form four piles (one per each animal) or they discard a card into a secret 5th pile.
When the secret pile contains 3 cards, these cards are revealed and put into the other four piles. The pile with the highest total value of cards grants his possessor 1 victory point.
The game ends when one of the player plays a special "end" card.

28674.description:
A description of the game from Goldsieber:

Akkon, 1189 AD. For weeks, the crusaders besieged the harbor cities in the holy land. There the death of their grandmaster shook up the knights of the Temple Order, and as the besiegers tried to find a successor for the grandmaster, a power struggle flared up among the Temple knights.

The players take on the roll of dignitaries in the Temple Order during the Third Crusade to the holy land. They strive to expand the power of their order in order to increase its gold and renown of the Temple Knights and spread belief in the holy land. This choice group in the Temple Order will determine the most capable member under them to become the new grandmaster.

Each player has 7 Temple Knights available each round. The player must use them in order to buy city cards, to finish them, and to increase gold, belief, power, and the appearance of the Temple Order. Whoever does this the best will receive additional privileges to help him realize his goals. Only the player who uses all of his possibilities and keeps his opponents in mind will be triumphant in the end.
28674.name: Akkon: Machtkampf der Tempelritter
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 14 – Goldsieber – Neuheiten Frühjahr 2007

28675.description:
Going Underground: Zoo Edition is the first game from Bright Sparx. It's played on a map of the London Underground and the idea is to catch animals that are on the loose. The counters representing the animals are spread across the board, face down. Each player gets the cards for five animals and the first to collect their set and get back to the zoo wins the game. There is an educational aspect as each card carries information about the animal depicted and the game is aimed at children and families.

Home Page: http://www.goingunderground.co.uk/
28675.name: Going Underground: Zoo Edition

28676.name: Wall Street Junior
28676.description:
The game was developed with the aid of stock exchange brokers. The target audience are those people who want to have an easy introduction on the way the stock exchange works.

The aim of the game is to make your starting capital grow by buying stocks and gold. The worth of the stock fluctuates throughout the game, and the aim is to buy/sell stock at the most opportune time.

Winner is the player with the highest worth of stock and gold.

28677.name: Quick & Dirty
28677.description:
This game comes in 3 versions: "Für Frauen" (for women), "Für Männer" (For men)"Für Manager" (For Manager).

It is a mixture between "Bulls**t-Bingo" and "Once upon a time". One Player draws random cards with words on it, usually words coming from management areas ("Shareholder-value") and he has to put them into a speech.
Every time he says one keyword the other players can mark them on a "Bingo"-Board and they get points for - well for Bingo basically.

28678.description:
Grand Conquest is very similar to earlier versions of Donald Benge's Conquest. However it adds some interesting features. Now there are camels, catapults, siege engines and a moat around the five home points. The tube package comes with a vinyl roll out map, pieces in more distinguishable colors than previous versions, and a separate puzzle book (The Conquest games have had collections of puzzles developed similar to chess puzzles that are quite entertaining and engaging for abstract strategy players).

Re-implements:

Conquest
28678.name: Grand Conquest

28679.name: Judkins shogi
28679.description: This modern variant of Shogi was designed by Paul Judkins of the UK sometime around 1998. It is played on a 6x6 board and uses the king, rook, bishop, gold, silver, horse, and pawn from the standard Shogi game. The promotion zone for each player consists of the final two ranks. Drops are permitted.

28680.description:
From the publisher's site:

The Tobruk Gamers Guide covers Advanced Tobruk, the monster-game that started it all. A move-by-move scenario replay, replete with analysis by the players, a detailed article on historical tactics -- worked up so it speaks 'ATS' system language -- and by an expert in desert warfare, and the first in a series of unpublished letter of Hal Hock in the 'Hock on Hock' series. And more, a LOT more!
28680.name: ATS: Tobruk Gamers Guide

28681.description:
From the publisher's website:

Experience WARMACHINE like never before with brilliant new artwork, a Formula P3 painting guide, and new fiction about your favorite characters and factions.

With 256 pages of updated and consolidated rules, scenarios, errata, and clarifications; striking new photos and a full color map of Western Immoren; and an expanded, detailed glossary, it's never been easier nor more fun to Play Like You've Got a Pair!

WARMACHINE: Prime Remix is your single undisputed gaming resource for high octane metal-on-metal action. Prepare yourself, for victory favors the bold!
28681.name: Warmachine Prime Remix

boardgamehonor: 2009 Charles S. Roberts Best Expansion or Supplement for an Existing Game Nominee
28682.description:
Combat Commander: Battle Pack #1 – Paratroopers is the first of what will be many themed collections of scenarios for use with the Combat Commander: Europe series of games. The theme of this first Battle Pack is focused on the exploits of American, German and even Russian Airborne forces. CC–Paratroopers features eleven new scenarios printed on cardstock, as well as four new maps. Future Battle Packs will be similarly structured and may also include new counters or new cards – with themes such as “Stalingrad”, “Partisans” and “Desert Rats” to name just a few.

COMPONENTS:
2 17" x 22" 2-sided color mapsheets
6 2-sided Scenario Cards

The scenarios included in CC–Paratroopers are:

“Fields of Fire” and “Fields of Blood” set at Lanzerath, Germany, 16 December 1944 – both the morning and the afternoon attacks (using a new map #25);
“Turnbull Turns ‘em” at Neuville-au-Plain, France, 6 June 1944 (using a new map #26);
“Carentan Causeway” at Carentan, France, 10 June 1944 (using a new map #27);
“No Ingouf Around” at Carentan, France, 11 June 1944 (using a new map #28);
“Operation Repulse” at Bastogne, Belgium, 27 December 1944;
“Red Skies at Night” at Veliki Bukrin Bridgehead, Russia, 25 September 1943;
“Blizzard Baptism” at Flamierge, Belgium, 4 January 1945;
“Look Mom, No Tanks!” near Trois Ponts, Belgium, 24 December 1944;
“We Go!” at St. Mere Eglise, France, 6 June 1944;
“Encircled at Hill 30” at Caponnet, France, 8 June 1944.




NOTE: CC–Paratroopers is not a complete game and requires ownership of Combat Commander: Europe to play.

Scenario designs in this first Pack are courtesy of Will Green, John Holme, Gregory L. Wong, Bryan Collars, Ric Van Dyke, Tray Green and Dan Holte.
28682.name: Combat Commander: Battle Pack #1 – Paratroopers

28683.name: Colpo grosso a Topolinia
28683.description:
This game was published in Italy in early '70.
Each player is a Disney character. Players are divided in 2 teams: "good guys" and "bad ones".
At the beginning "Bad ones" secretly choose a location where they will try a great robbery. "Good guys" try to find what is the target of the other team.
If "Bad ones" successfully rob their target, the player with the loot tries to reach one board edge to escape and win.

28684.name: Yamodo!
28684.description:
Read, Draw, Write... Pass it On!

A card is drawn from the stack and players must attempt to define the made-up word written at the top. Each card also has a small drawing for players to add on to. When you draw or get passed a card, you add to both the definition and the drawing, passing the card around until the word has been full defined by the players.

28685.name: What's Wild?!
28685.description:
What's Wild?! is a rummy-based card game for 2-7 players Ages 7 and up. Instead of cards featuring suits, the game's cards are made up of four different animal skins—alligator, cheetah, peacock, and zebra. And to further the "Wild" theme of the game, when a player's hand allows him or her to end a round of play, he or she must declare, "I'm going wild!"

A complete game of What's Wild?! includes 10 rounds. Each player receives three cards to begin the first round, and by the final round, each player is holding 12 cards in his or her hand. Players collect appropriately-named "herds" and "caravans"—called "books" and "runs" in traditional rummy games— throughout each round, until they are able to "Go Wild," or end the round.

Four cards - called "Chameleon Cards" change the Wild Card when played throughout the game. The four Chameleon Cards give the game a sort of "Old Maid" feel, in that if the card is in a player's hand when another player "Goes Wild," the player holding the Chameleon Card is awarded the maximum amount of points. In a game in which the low score wins, players must carefully weigh their options for playing Chameleon Cards when holding one. Playing the card too early may allow the Wild Card to be changed in later turns, but holding on to it too long may lead to an stampede of points. The Chameleon Card makes each round of every game of What's Wild?! new, exciting, and completely unpredictable.

Home Page: http://www.whatswildcardgame.com/

28686.name: Knights and Knaves
28686.description:
Subtitled: A Skirmish-Level Game of Combat in the Middle Ages.

Mainly for 25mm figures. 1 figure=1 man, 1 inch=6 feet, 1 turn=10-30 seconds. Typically, one player controls around 20 figures. The rulebook comes with three sheets of Charts & Tables and a sheet of Organizational Chart (record sheet). 13 sample Organizations are listed.

Command Range (5 inches) is very important. In command figures choose Movement rate (full/half/no move). They are free to fire/melee. Out of command figures receive random Orders determined by rolls on a chart. Also, rules on morale, fatigue and ammo are included.

Later expanded by "More Knights and Knaves" (scenarios) and "Castles, Cogs & Chevauchees" (Siege, Ships and Campaign using maps).

All three now available free online.

http://www.hisentco.com/

28688.name: OPORD
28688.description:
The game is on the market. Anyone attenting RECON in Orlando is welcome to stop by the Flaming Monkey Games booth for a quick demo. :)

OPORD is a game designed specifically to allow players to experience the sensation of launching a coordinated combined arms attack. The game challenges a player with modern land warfare based upon existing tactical doctrine at the battalion level, but condensed in such a way as to make the make exiting and playable. Players develop and execute operations to affect a coordinated tactical victory over their opponent. To win, a player will have to successfully execute the instructions on his Mission Card while keeping the opponent from doing likewise.

In modern warfare, there is no shoot, maneuver sequence, as all shooting and maneuvering is simultaneous. This is a key difference between modern warfare and that of WWII, and thus a main component of OPORD. Movement is continuous, and shooting is sustained. This is a key concept built into the OPORD game engine. The variable turn sequence forces tactical forethought beyond the old “my turn, your turn” design mentality, and as a result players get a sense of fluidity of motion throughout the game.

Another key aspect of OPORD is the mission card driven objectives. Players are not playing to slay each other’s armies, since this is akin to senseless banzai charges with no real aim other than to roll dice. Rather, the game is set around typical “real world” sorts of missions that soldiers are given to accomplish. Seize this hill, secure this route, recon in force here, set up a defense there—all of these are typical missions you’ll see in your mission cards. And like the real world, you job is to use your troops and support elements to accomplish the mission.

In short, OPORD is a game that very closely relates the gaming experience to that of a real life Battalion Commander but in a fun way. Receive your orders, allocate your troops and resources, design your plan, execute your plan, and complete the mission.

A typical turn. Both players dice for initiative and turn sequence. Initiative is obvious, winner goes first. Sequencing dice determines the player's turn sequence. Sequencing can be shoot/move/fight or move/shoot/fight. the initiative winner goes first in the first two phases, while in the third phase "fight" all combat is simultaneous. Movement variables are factored into the terrain boards, so there is no worry about modifiers for moving. In combat, units shoot/fight collectively if in the same sector, or individually if in separate sectors. Essentially both players dice (attack dice for phasing player, defend dice for non-phasing). The interactive nature of every phase of every turn means no players are passive, which gives both a sense of fluidity. Results are based upon combat dicing. Units can be depleted, eliminated, or forced to withdraw. The object of the game is to accomplish your mission and deny the enemy his. While there are some mission cards that are all out attacks, most of the missions require you to combat in support of your own mission or to deny the other's.

Terrain boards are modular, so there is no limit to the size map one can create. But a game comes with six maps.

28689.name: Princess Sleeping Beauty
28689.description:
In Princess Sleeping Beauty, the players portray princes hoping to awaken the sleeping princess. In order to do so properly, a prince must have three roses when he's scaled the tower to kiss her. The princes can collect a rose by rolling it on the die, or by picking one from the tower.

Ages 4-10

HABA game number 4494

28690.name: Caçada ao Tesouro
28690.description:
Caçada ao Tesouro is the Portuguese for Treasure Hunt. This is a game recommended for children Ages 5 and up.
Translated from the Box:
"Each step must be thought out very well. The one who capturea the hunters or deactivates the robots and finds the best treasures will be the champion of this Super-championship"

It is a chess variant with a child appealing theme pasted on. One player has control of eight pawns and the other of the two knights. The player with the pawns hides the treasures on the opposite side of the board, each treasure has a different point value. You play in two rounds,each player plays one time with the pawns and another with the knights. The players that when playing with the pawns gets the most points is the winner.

28691.description:
This entry is for all Warhammer Armies books.

The Warhammer Armies Army books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
28691.name: Warhammer Armies: Army Books

28693.name: Triagonal
28693.description:
Winner of a Major FUN Award, and more recently a Dr Toy ~ Best Picks for 2008 Award...

Triagonal can be played and won in several ways...
Win by forming a line of tiles or, by forming a large 3 x 3 x 3 Triangle of 9 tiles or, if the board goes through to completion, by winning the majority of board sectors ~ plus any Bonus points you may have earned during the game.

There are several other different games to play too, all of which can be played on our unique board including ~ one game which plays without the board at all.

When playing any of the 'Die Included' game option:
Players require some die throwing luck, but also, planning skills to place their won sector formers into the board to their best advantage and without leaving openings for opponents to gain from.

With skill and being observant, a player on their turn could win one or several sectors from their die roll.

Bonus Points:
Players can earn themselves 'Five' bonus points for Each (and every) Hexagon formed in their colour tiles.
Bonus points are added to the 'Final Tile Count' and could dramatically change the outcome of who actually wins the game.

What mood are you in today.?:
Choose a game option to suit your mood... Using None, One or Both custom die for different types of game.

There are Seven Game Options on the game box and 'More' additional FREE game options which can be downloaded from the publisher's website.
Note: The additional game playing options were created after the game had been produced.

Game playing options include:
Pure Strategy, Chance, Quick, Solo, Team, Gambling (Fun or Real), Line Em Up 4 to 7, How Many (requires maths), Pass Over (no board), Exchange and more.

Include Exchange into your game and you could Turn Back Time by exchanging opponents tiles for your own, and maybe obtain that lost five point hexagon or even instantly win the game..!

Whichever option you choose to play:
Watch out for the Instant Win, Bonus Hexagon and Line Forming opportunities.

Triagonal can accommodate 1 to 4 players Ages 5 and up.

You can play Triagonal almost anywhere because game pieces are located and retained in the board during play but, are instantly cleared ready for the next challenging game.

All Triagonal components are injection molded:
Including the white triangular game board, 84 black Sector Formers, 120 Scoring Tiles (30 of each in red, yellow, blue and green). Also included are two custom 'printed' dice.

Home Page: http://sites.google.com/site/acumenboardgames2/home
Note to all visitors:
Acumen board games no longer exists as a business but, if you want to see more information Triagonal and other games stuff which are designed by myself (Dave Barnes), you can visit the following web address... https://sites.google.com/site/acumenboardgames2/home
Hope to see you there.

See an advanced version called 'Supergrid'

28694.name: Day of the Rangers (Mogadishu 1993)
28694.description:
The Raid in Mogadishu on 3 October 1993 was the seventh in a series of raids mounted by US SOF (Special Operations Forces) Task Force Ranger (TFR). It was an attempt to immediately and dramatically seize the leadership of General Mohammad Farrah Aideed’s Habr Gidr, which was in conflict with UN forces being supported by the US. What was planned as a lightning raid soon escalated into a decisive, bitter and costly two-day battle. The aftermath led to the withdrawal of US and UN forces in Somalia and the consolidation of Aideed and Habr Gidr power. It was the most intense fighting the US military had seen since Vietnam. The course of the events has become familiar through the film based on Mark Bowden’s Black Hawk Down. For the Somalis the battle is remembered as “Malinki Ranger” which translates into English as “Day of the Ranger”. As has usually been the case Post Cold-War the fighting in Somalia was not about ideology but about Aideed and his Habr Gidr faction. In a war about an individual, seizure raids by SOF become strategic operations. Fittingly, it was also a conflict that pitted Aideed’s strategy of attrition against SOF tactics of raiding.

This is a very simple two player simulation of the October 3, 1993 firefight between Task Force Ranger and the Habr Gidr Clan in Mogadishu, Somalia. Each player controls either Task Force Ranger or the Habr Gidr Clan. The use of the title Day of the Rangers refers to the Somali name for the fight-’Malinki Ranger.’ The object of the game is to amass as many victory points as possible, the winner gains the most points, however the victory conditions set up to provide a balanced scenario outcome.

Game Files Direct Download: LINK

28695.description:
When Hell Froze Over is an operational level simulation of the Soviet counter-offensive around the city of Stalingrad in November 1942. Codenamed Operation Uranus, this offensive saw massive thrusts both to the North and South the city itself. Utilizing vast reserves of men and armor that the Germans where unaware of, these two thrusts penetrated deep behind Axis lines causing the German 6th Army to become pinched off, encircled and ultimately doomed. This simulation offers players two scenarios; Firstly the initial stages of Operation Uranus demonstrating the first chaotic days of the Soviet assault, Secondly there is a scenario simulating the ensuing efforts of the Germans to relieve the pocket whilst the Soviets strive to collapse it.

Game Components:

- Map board
- Sheet of Counters
- Game Markers
- Rules Booklet
- Scenario Leaflet
- Player Aid Sheet
- One 6 sided die
28695.name: When Hell Froze Over (Stalingrad, 1942)

28696.name: BattleFront
28696.description:
BattleFront is a Cardgame for 2 players set during the WWII conflict.

The players fight for victory during battles on 5 different fronts:
- right
- right/center
- center
- left/center
- left
Win the first to achieve definitive victory on 3 of the 5 fronts.

Players draws their cards from a common card deck made of 70 cards.
The cards are divided into 7 categories, each of them is composed by 10 cards with a value from 1 to 10.
The 7 categories are:
- Leader
- Troops
- Planes
- Tanks
- Ballistic
- Strategy
- Fortifications

Each turn consists of 3 different phases:
1.Logistic
2.Line Up
3.Battle

LOGISTIC
Each player draw 7 cards.

LINE UP
Place 1 card on the board. (one each player)

BATTLE
Sum the force (value on each cards) to decide who wins on different “fronts”.

The front is considered “secured” after 3 wins in a row.

28697.name: StarWars DogFight
28697.description:
StarWars DogFight is a cardgame/boardgame for 2 players.
As you can imagine by the name it’s set in the fantastic world created by George Lucas: StarWars.
The things you need to play is the dedicated deck available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section, a little board (8x8) and a set of counters.

Each player starts with 8 ships.
The main objective is to kill 5 enemy ships (the remaining 3 will flee for fear).

REBELS starting units:
2 A-Wing (mov: 6, range: 3)
2 B-Wing (mov: 4, range: 4)
2 X-Wing (mov: 5, range: 4)
2 Y-Wing (mov: 4, range: 3)

IMPERIAL starting units:
6 TIE Fighter (mov: 5, range: 3)
2 TIE Interceptor (mov: 6, range: 4)

Players draws their cards from a common card deck.

The 3 main phases of the game are:
1- Plan
2- Movement
3- Fire

28698.name: Stellar Poker
28698.description:
Stellar Poker is a cardgame for 2+ players.
As you can imagine by the name, it’s a “variant” of the classic game named Poker so the only thing you need to play is the dedicated deck available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
All the game is set in the space and the usual numeration of the traditional cards is replaced by the sequence of the planets in the solar system.

There are 13 different cards for each seed:
1 Sun
2 Mercury Internal Planet
3 Venus Internal Planet
4 Earth Internal Planet
5 Moon Internal Planet
6 Mars Internal Planet
7 Asteroids
8 Jupiter External Planet
9 Saturn External Planet
10 Uranus External Planet
11 Neptune External Planet
12 Pluto External Planet
13 Comets

28699.name: Kryptonim: Lew Morski
28699.description: Operation: Sealion is a wargame of aerial combat over Great Britain in World War II. The mechanics include such things as bomb weight, a planes altitude, speed or sun light. The game has a number of scenarios, with different goals, planes and complexity, from around the period of the invasion.

28700.name: Jobber
28700.description:
The object of Jobber is to eliminate all of your own pieces. This can be accomplished by getting your pieces to their elimination corner or having your opponent jump your pieces Checkers style.
The Jobber piece makes the game unique. The Jobber piece must stay in the Jobber row outlined by red squares and shaped like a plus sign in the middle of the board. You can use your Jobber piece to block your opponent's pieces or to advance your own pieces by having them jump over your jobber piece.

28701.description:
A golf simulation which includes all the elements of this sport: driving, pitching, putting, holes in one, water hazards, penalty shots, etc.

A full 18-hole course is featured on a beautiful huge board (98 x 68 cms).

Strategy and luck combine: players select a club (aggressive? conservative?) and then spin the distance disk to see how good their stroke was. The disk contains 26 different outcomes for each club.
28701.name: Tee Off! Das Golf-Brettspiel

28702.description:
Federation Commander: Academy is a lower-cost entry-level game for the Federation Commander Series. It includes the complete rulebook, counters, four ship cards, paper map, and a reference card.

Players will need dice and markers to play; everything else is included.

An expansion, Federation Commander: Graduation, allows owners of both Academy and Graduation to have everything in the base set: Federation Commander: Klingon Border.

Expanded by:

Federation Commander: Graduation
Federation Commander: Briefing #1
28702.name: Federation Commander: Academy

28703.name: O Guerreiro
28703.description:
The WARRIOR is wargame to combat foot in the pre-Renaissance period. Your system of simple game allows animated simulations and pleasure without sacrificing the realism or the coherence of the simulation unnecessarily. With him it is possible to simulate any combat foot of the pre-Renaissance period. Each scenario of the game (to be published) it will contains a brochure with your add rules supplementary.

O GUERREIRO é wargame de combate a pé no período pré-renascentista. Seu sistema de jogo simples permite encenações movimentadas e agrádaveis sem sacrificar desnacessáriamente o realismo ou a coerência da simulação. Com ele é possível encenar práticamente qualquer combate a pé do período pré-renascentista. Cada cenário do jogo (a ser lançado) contém um brochura com suas regras adcionais.

http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/guerreiro.htm

28704.name: Final Demand
28704.description:
Final Demand - The Disconnection Game

From the rulebook:

"Players race to connect their houses to the water, electricity and telephone supplies; then they try to remain connected, while disconnecting the other players.

The winner is the last player to retain all or some of his supplies. Players who lose all of their supplies are out of the game!"

The game consists of a board, counters, cards, 30 coloured rings and 6 telephone poles.

28705.description:
Pizza Box Baseball puts you and your opponent on the mound and at the plate. It's a game-long showdown. The pitcher must figure out the best way to approach the hitter. Try to get ahead using balls or strikes? The hitter must decide whether to be aggressive or patient. Attack and swing? Or stay away from pitches outside the strike zone? Both players try to work each at-bat to their advantage.

Players use one card per at-bat. A result card reveals the action, and play continues. Players track the action using the game board or using the score pad. Score more runs by the end of the game to win.

Four strategy levels allow players to add stealing, bunting, pitchouts, different hitter strengths, pitchers that get tired, and more!

Players can complete a full game of baseball in an hour or less (20-30 minutes at the most basic game level). Real baseball drama offers a baseball experience any fan can enjoy. Play ball!
28705.name: Pizza Box Baseball
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 53 - Session Reviews: Ticket To Ride: The Card Game, Say Anything, and Pizza Box Baseball
Game Gab: Origins 2009: On the Line Games
Show #18.5 Session Report: Pizza Box Baseball, and Cargo Noir
Show #18: Pizza Box Baseball, and Cargo Noir
The Spiel #51 - Take Me Out to Olympus
The Spiel #68 - That's A Wrap - 2008 Holiday Gift Guide

28706.name: Dungeons and Patterns
28706.description:
This game was created by a couple of ubergeeks (of the software development variety) for other geeks. You can (as of this typing Feb 16 2007) read more about it at

http://oopsla.acm.org/OOPSLA02/ap/files/tut-32.html

Contents: one dice, two map sheets, a guide for the GM, and room descriptions/pictures for the players.

It's sort of a cross between zendo and a ridiculously light RPG. One person is the GM (or "Pattern Master") and describes what the other players in the room see. Everyone else in the room cooperates as the group explores a dungeon and earns keys by solving riddles together.

The riddles are usually of the form "You enter the next room and see these few objects." Players then suggest things to do to investigate the objects and their interactions. The GM tells them what happens as they explore. Eventualy the players regonize the software development pattern for which these objects are a metaphor.

The game was created for a conference attended by software developers and presumably has limited appeal outside that group, as few others would ever be able to identify the metaphor, having never read about software development patterns.

28707.name: Jewel of Truth
28707.description:
Jewel of Truth is a boardgame version of spin-the-bottle, designed for young girls.

From the manufacturer:

"Jewel of Truth will expose your innermost secrets and reveal your future! If the Jewel of Truth points to your colored jewel, you must reveal a secret, while other players try to
guess what you will say. When players match your answer, you both earn fortune cards."

There are five types of fortune cards; each player may hold no more than one of each type. The first player to collect five fortune cards wins.

28708.name: Piratas del Caribe
28708.description:
Save yourself if you can! You will need all your ability and a little bit of luck to stay onboard the ship, when the wind makes your boat stagger and the waves cover it over. Roll the dice and try to maintain the load in perfect balance. If your pirate remains in the boat when all the others have fallen into the water, you are the winner.

Components:

1 pirate ship
18 pirates
7 coins
1 dice
rulebook

28709.name: To Be Continued... by Gaslight
28709.description: To Be Continued by GASLIGHT is a game that pits steely-eyed, fling-jawed, barrel-chested, two-fisted, deadeye, tough as woodpecker lips, stud among studs, no kidding, stuff of legends, hero-type guys against colorful, charismatic, egomaniacal, dastardly, nefarious villains and their mindless minions. Games, called episodes, are linked together to form twelve-episode serials in the tradition of the great movie serials of the 1930's and 1940's or the Pulp movies of the 1950's.

28710.name: Starship Troopers Evolution
28710.description:
From the publisher's site:

Starship Troopers Evolution
Based on the ever popular Heinlein novel and the highly successful film, this game uses the Evolution system to bring the War of the Species to your tabletop. Pre-painted Mobile Infantry, Arachnids, Skinnies and Forth miniatures will be appearing in the first wave of releases for this game, hitting your local stores in August.

From the publisher's monthly 'Signs & Portents' magazine:

Starship Troopers Evolution is based on the same game system as the original, though everything has been tightened, streamlined, and developed to give a far more tactical game. The design of the best miniatures in the old range have been retained, the others improved and, to top it all off, everything will come pre-painted, saving you the trouble of creating forces from scratch, and allowing you to get straight into the game itself.

Replaced

Starship Troopers Miniatures Game

28711.description:
You will travel to Never Never Land and actually become Peter Pan or one of the other well-loved characters, and your aim is to become the first player to reach Captain Hook's Galleon - the Jolly Roger.

On your journey, you will encounter many obstacles: watch out for the Crocodile Square and avoid if you can the gushing mysterious river that could sweep you down the board. There are many pitfalls awaiting the unsuspecting player.

ages 3 & above
28711.name: Peter Pan's Adventure Land Board Game

28712.description: To move your rabbit playing piece from "start" to "home" over 49 steps, using the roll of the dice. You are helped on your way by taking short-cut paths if they are landed on, but you are also hindered if you land on a burrow, and you take a short-cut backwards!
28712.name: Paths and Burrows (The World of Beatrix Potter)

28713.name: Minnesotaopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
28713.description:
From the back of the box:

"To Play: Buy campus properties and favorite area businesses as you make your way around the board. Collect credit hours and trade them for diplomas. Academic Probation sends you home...or make the Dean's list and collect a $200 scholarship."

This is a University of Minnesota Monopoly themed variant.

28714.name: The New Avengers Board Game
28714.description: The objective of the game is to be the first player to get their three Avenger figures into the Assignment Completed Area.

28715.name: PanzerTruppe
28715.description:
From the author:

"PanzerTruppe is a set of tactical 1:1 rules for gaming WWII armored combat using 6mm micro armor and 10mm miniatures (1/300 through 1/200 scale). The basic rules comprise only a few pages of text. Optional rules are provided for advanced play involving infantry, anti-tank guns, artillery, mortars, air support, minefields, indirect fire, hedgerows, hidden set up, and more. Specifications are provided for more than 200 armored fighting vehicles covering all major nationalities from 1939 through 1945."

28716.name: Ben 10 Collectable Card Game
28716.description:
Battle your opponent by transforming in to your favorite alien from the Omnitrix! Attack your opponents forces on Earth or in space. Use a fireball from Heatblast or the strength of Fourarms to carry the day!

You start the game with 10,000 life points, and lose when your life points reach 0 on the play mat. Cards have a healthy and injured Battle rating, and aliens have a transformation time limit. Use an Effect card to cause your heroes to appear, or a Trick card to confuse your opponent. Your starting deck is 40 cards.

28717.description: Please don't feed the Monsters! In the modern world, the things that go "bump" in the night are real. As a vampire, werewolf, mummy, poltergeist, or zombie, you stalk the city after dark, searching for human victims to sate your inhuman appetites. Be it blood, bones, brains, organs, or spirit that you crave, you prowl the shadows in search of prey!
28717.name: Monster Mayhem

28718.name: Kanji Battle
28718.description:
In this card game you take the role of a Japanese mage, and you will battle others that, like you, long for the power the Kirin confer to their lords. For that, you will have to use spells binding the power the kanji give to the cards. In turns, you will choose how to combine them to make the most spectacular attack, to obtain one of the three Kirin cards that will give you the victory.

Kanji battle is an agile game, quick to learn, where you will have a good time diving into the most magical Japan.

Learn Japanese playing...

Moreover, if you love the Japanese culture and you want to get fluent with the language, with the game you will learn to read kanji easily.

The deck consists of 100 cards needed to pass the Official Level 4 Japanese exam (Noken 4), and can be used both to play and to study the language.

Home Page: http://kanjibattle.edgeent.com

28719.description:
Solve a murder in an evening with friends.

Lord David Coppertone was hosting the annual convention of the Magic Ring in his new home Magic Mansion, which is being attended by the world's top magicians, conjurors, illusionists, escapologists and mystics.

Lord Coppertone performs his most dangerous of stunts to escape from the medieval Iron Maiden torture chamber. However, all did not go according to plan and Lord Coppertone fails to make the great escape.

Host your own party and discover who conjured up this cunning plan...or is it just an illusion!

The Game Pack includes all the material, information and suggestions for you to host this party...including costume suggestions, menu suggestions, invitations, name tags and clues.
28719.name: Murder Mystery Party:  Murder by Magic

boardgamehonor: 2008 Golden Geek Best Gamer's Board Game Nominee
2008 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
28720.description:
Brass: Lancashire — first published as Brass — is an economic strategy game that tells the story of competing cotton entrepreneurs in Lancashire during the industrial revolution. You must develop, build, and establish your industries and network so that you can capitalize demand for iron, coal and cotton. The game is played over two halves: the canal phase and the rail phase. To win the game, score the most victory points (VPs), which are counted at the end of each half. VPs are gained from your canals, rails, and established (flipped) industry tiles. Each round, players take turns according to the turn order track, receiving two actions to perform any of the following:


Build an industry tile
Build a rail or canal
Develop an industry
Sell cotton
Take a loan


At the end of a player's turn, they replace the two cards they played with two more from the deck. Turn order is determined by how much money a player spent on the previous turn, from lowest spent first to highest spent. This turn order mechanism opens some strategic options for players going later in the turn order, allowing for the possibility of back-to-back turns.

After all the cards have been played the first time (with the deck size being adjusted for the number of players), the canal phase ends and a scoring round commences. After scoring, all canals and all of the lowest level industries are removed for the game, after which new cards are dealt and the rail phase begins. During this phase, players may now occupy more than one location in a city and a double-connection build (though expensive) is possible. At the end of the rail phase, another scoring round takes place, then a winner is crowned.

The cards limit where you can build your industries, but any card can be used for the develop, sell cotton or build connections actions. This leads to a strategic timing/storing of cards. Resources are common so that if one player builds a rail line (which requires coal) they have to use the coal from the nearest source, which may be an opponent's coal mine, which in turn gets that coal mine closer to scoring (i.e., being utilized).

Brass: Lancashire, the 2018 edition from Roxley Games, reboots the original Warfrog Games edition of Brass with new artwork and components, as well as a few rules changes:


The virtual link rules between Birkenhead have been removed.
The three-player experience has been brought closer to the ideal experience of four players by shortening each half of the game by one round and tuning the deck slightly to ensure a consistent experience.
Two-player rules have been created and are playable without the need for an alternate board.
The level 1 cotton mill is now worth 5 VP to make it slightly less terrible.
boardgameversion: Fred Distribution Second Edition First Printing
Wargames Club Publishing Chinese first edition
28720.name: Brass: Lancashire
boardgamepodcastepisode: #44: Anachrony six-pack review and on tap; Fugitive; Valeria Card Kingdoms; Veggie Garden
BGTG 84 - Martin Wallace games (Brass, Tinner's Trail, Byzantium)
BGTG 97 - All About Brass (with Stephanie Kelleher)
clp047 – cubelove podcast – cubebrawl Brass vs Age of Industry
Ep 46 Board With Life
Episode #40 - Top Ten Route-Building Games
Episode 09 - Online Gaming

Episode 23 part 1: Mars, Tsuro and Planetarium
Episode 25 - Kickstarting the Habit
Episode 34 - Top 50, Picks 10-1
Episode 4 - More Than Two Need Not Apply

Episode 44 - Bruxelles 1893 Review

The Game Pit: Episode 40 - Council Chamber Mega Review of 2014 with Top 5s
The Good, The Board and the SPECIAL EPISODE!!
Vox Republica 108: 2016 Predictions
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 85!

28721.description:
This expansion/mini-campaign lets the characters play two different sides. Players can choose to be "animal men" serving Dr. Moreau or play the U.R.E.F. exploring the strange happenings in this sector of space.

Expands:

Battlestations
28721.name: Battlestations: The Planet of Dr. Moreau

boardgamehonor: 2008 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
28723.description:
In the harbor a fleet of commerce ships is waiting to be loaded with goods. Each vessel needs a certain combination of goods. The players take the roles of traders, trying to fill their warehouses with goods which are then in turn transferred to the ships in the harbor. They have to pay attention to the right combination of goods because the captains only accept the goods from a single trader and expect a complete delivery before their ships leave the harbor. It is also very important to not let the right moment to transfer goods to the vessels pass, because the fleet will leave the harbor when the storage space is full and the winds are helpful. The players always have to be before the wind to actively influence the events.

Contents

120 action cards
60 goods cards
60 Guilders cards
46 ship cards
4 warehouses
1 starting player token
1 rules booklet
28723.name: Before the Wind
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Short One About PAX East 2012

28724.description:
From the publisher:

The time and place is Mongolia of the 1920s. Warlords and free-roaming bandits battle for control of the countryside. Your team of researchers and explorers must race against time to recover the fossils and get them out of the dangerous warzone and back to the safety of the International Zone in Shanghai.

The scenarios in Dragon Bones: Adventures in the Gobi Desert are designed for 2 to 6 players. There are four chapters (scenarios), each is capable of being played in a single evening or several can be played at one session.

This book also introduces nine new archetypes to .45 Adventure; including Professors, Bandits, and the Dragon Lady. There are new rules for Mounted models and eight new skills you can add to provide even more diversification for your figures.

So put on your campaign hat, strap on your .45 and get ready for Dragon Bones: Adventures in the Gobi Desert!

44 Pages
28724.name: Dragon Bones

28725.name: The Gargoyle: Death Soldiers of the Jade Hood
28725.description:
From the Publisher:

The Gargoyle: Death Soldiers of the Jade Hood is the third supplement to the .45 Adventure rules and covers rules for campaigns and experience for your pulp heroes and villains.

This supplement explains how to set up your campaign, what you should do in advance, and even how to use minimal scenics to create a series of games.

It also provides new archetypes, new abilities, and expanded rules to allow more than just combat to occur in each game. There is also a nine-part campaign game where the outcome of each chapter effects what happens in the next one. Can the Gargoyle and his compatriots, along with the New Commerce police force, stop the Jade Hood and his mad plans to enslave the citizens of the city?

You will also get background material on the city of New Commerce to help you plan your own campaign in the home city of The Gargoyle and the Jade Hood!

28726.name: German Rails
28726.description:
This is a web-publsihed variant based on the well-known Empire Builder system by Mayfair Games. True to its name, the game takes place on a map of Germany. Of interest to gamers, one of the loads in this game is games. This was designed by the same designer of the similar game, African Rails.

The game can be downloaded at:
http://www.zahag.de/MMsKSg/rails/gr/main.html

28727.name: African Rails
28727.description: A web-published variant of the well-known Empire Builder system by Mayfair Games. True to its name, this one takes place on the continent of Africa. This was designed by the same designer of the similar game, German Rails.

28728.name: Inheritance
28728.description:
Requiring no prior bible knowledge, Inheritance teaches the Seven Pillars of Wisdom (Prov.9:1) while players have fun trading, hugging, paying tithes and making offerings for the poor. The winner ascending to the center of the inner board celebrates Christ as the Lamb of God in a final result where everyone wins as "Happy is the man who finds Wisdom." (Prov.3:13).
Designed for 3-7 players and ages from 8-to adult, game play in Inheritance offers a level of play which will be immediately familiar to both Monopoly and Parcheesi players, providing a completely new board game experience and principally cultivating the Wisdom of God.

28729.name: Het Grote Ronde van Vlaanderen Spel
28729.description:
A roll and move game about the most famous bicycle race in Flanders " The Tour of Flanders". Players have a choice of one of 3 standard dice (D4, D6, D8), or, if they have the proper cards, a D10, D12 or D16.

There are 3 levels of play, which can be mixed (1 and 3, or 1,2 and 3)) containing the more advanced rules adding strategic cards, which can influenec also other players changes, negative cards, and the peleton, which just like in the real cycle competition can influence the results of each player quite intensively and which for the more strategic gamers is the ultimate way to use them at their advantage.

Undoubtly real cycle geeks will have great fun playing the roles of their cycle hero's, but also the gamer can find his kicks in the game once all the levels are combined.

The game is available in 5 languages and can be ordered on:
Home Page: http://www.rondevanvlaanderenspel.com/ (English content is not yet available)

28730.name: Laerad
28730.description:
As written on the front cover: "Laerad is a strategic-level fantasy war game"

Up to seven fantasy armies struggle for supremacy on the world of Laerad.

The game requires 30 (!) 6-sided dice: 10 red, 10 white and 10 blue ones.

The armies are identical (yes, even dwarves and elves...), but an optional rule adds some racial differences.

Rules are in Italian and English.

28731.name: Wildcat Soccer
28731.description:
This is a card game for 2 players. Available for free download or in the files section.

Players represent the coaches of different soccer teams, but not "professional teams". You have to train and play with a team full of young and unexperienced players!

Play a game divided in 2 halves (like a real soccer game) and choose the right action in the right moment, because different players have different abilities (attack, defense, strength, etc.).

Who wins the match, wins the game.

Home Page: http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html

28732.description:
From the back cover:

""Let the Games begin!"

The bay door swings up and away, revealing your opponent across a labyrinth of obstacles rising from the arena floor. Barely aware that the signal has been given, you are off and running, weapons blazing to cover your desperate sprint to safety. Diving through a maelstrom of explosions, you round a corner and charge your foe, ignoring the insistent flashing of your warning lights.

Welcome to the Game World, where war is a busines and life is a gamble.

Solaris VII is a supplemental for use with BattleTech and MechWarrior, providing everything needed for a MechWarrior to experience the life of a gladiator up close and personal. From the deadly 'Mech duels to the nightly intrigues at Thor's Shieldhall, Solaris VII challenges all the skills your characters possess.

Solaris VII includes a full-color map of Solaris City, a gazetteer of the Game World, a gamemaster's guide, and a full-color map for each of the 5 arenas run by the Great Houses of the Inner Sphere. Solaris VII also introduces the BattleMech Dueling System, a BattleTech expansion for running one-to-one tactical combat with more tactical options than ever before.

How good are you?

On Solaris, finding out will get you rich or get you killed."

User comment:

Solaris VII is a supplement for use with Battletech. In addition to providing arena maps and scenarios, it introduces the "Battlemech Dueling System"

The Battlemech Dueling System is an expansion for running one-to-one compbat, with more tactical options than before.

Expands:

BattleTech




The BattleMech's introduced in this box set weren't added to the mainstream BattleTech universe until FanPro released the Classic BattleTech: Technical Readout: 3055 Upgrade, 14 years after Solaris VII was first printed.
28732.name: BattleTech: Solaris VII – The Game World

28733.description:
A book of six American Civil War scenarios for use with the popular set of Victorian Science Fiction rules: GASLIGHT.

Contains Board setup, Victory conditions, and background information basd on an alternative history.

Expands:

Gaslight
28733.name: The American Civil War by Gaslight, Part I:1861-63

28734.description:
You have always thought.. “There has got to be an easier way to get around town!” Well, now you found one... Or did you? There can’t be zombies underground, right?

Zombies!!! 6: 6 Feet Under adds a whole new “level” of to the Zombies!!! series. With this expansion players are now free to explore the underground subways and sewers beneath the city.

This expansion could be played stand-alone with shotgun guys (or other player markers) and tokens for bullets and hearts.
28734.name: Zombies!!! 6: Six Feet Under

28735.name: Captain Scarlet Game
28735.description:
Waddington's Captain Scarlet Game - The fight with the Mysterons.

Based on Gerry Anderson's TV series "Captain Scarlet and the Mysterons".
Licensed by Century 21 Merchandising Ltd.

Important people in Europe, as in the rest of the world, are under the constant threat of the Mysterons. A Conference has been called - to take place on the southern border of Yugoslavia - to which Heads of Government must be brought from four Regional Bases. Spectrum Patrol Cars, under the command of Captain Scarlet, Captain Blue, Captain Ochre and Lt. Green are assigned to this task.

After completing this assignment... the Conference decides to send new and detailed defence plans to places all over the Continent. It will require several separate journeys and each one must end at Durness, Scotland... where a plane waits to take information to Cloudbase.
It is the duty of Captain Scarlet and his colleagues to take a convoy along this route and get at least one Patrol Car through to Durness. The Mysterons, will of course, try to destroy the plans.

28736.name: Office Gossip
28736.description:
Office Gossip is game of scheming and intrigue set in an office environment for five to thirteen (or more) players. All players but one are dedicated office managers just doing their best to help the company. One player is a gossip who’s decided that the best way to get ahead is to eliminate competition by slandering the other managers. Will you figure out who the gossip is before you get demoted to “sanitation engineer”?

Office Gossip borrows almost all of the same play elements of the well-known public domain game Werewolf, also known as Mafia. Where Werewolf requires a player to stay out of the game to act as a Narrator, Office Gossip uses a custom set of cards to eliminate the need for a Narrator.

Home Page: http://www.invisible-city.com/play/435/

28737.name: Amen! Game
28737.description: This game is a Bible trivia version of Bingo. But instead of the letters of "bingo" for the columns, the columns of this game are A, M, E, N and !. According to the rules of the game: the exclamation point column is to be identified as the "Halleluiah" column. Another difference is that the moderator does not simply call out squares to be covered on the player's card, but will indicate a column and read a question from one of five question cards. If you know the answer and have the answer on your card, then you cover that square. For instance, the moderator might say: "Column A. Who killed Goliath?" If you have David in your card's Column A, you would cover it. The free square is known in this game as "Free Salvation by Jesus." The first player to complete a horizontal, vertical or diagonal row calls out "Amen!" and wins the game.

28738.description:
In the two-player abstract strategy game, Kamon, a hexagonal board is filled randomly with 36 tokens. Each token is valued 1-6, in each of 6 different symbols. The black player starts by replacing one of the tokens with one of their 18 pawns. The white player does the same thing, now constrained by black's choice: The token she selects must be either the same symbol or the same number.

The game ends immediately when one of three victory conditions are fulfilled:

A player connects two opposite edges with their pawns (as in Hex).
A player completely surrounds one or more spaces - those spaces could be either empty or occupied by the opponent's pawns.
A player has prevented their opponent from playing any more.




Reimplemented by


Niya
28738.name: Kamon

28739.description:
Garibaldi: La Trafila is a boardgame that makes you live the events which occurred in august 1849, near Ravenna (Romagna, Italy), when Garibaldi, hunted by the Austrians for fifteen days, succeeded to hide in valleys and in pine forests to reach salvation. A player is Garibaldi in hiding, the others are the Austrian patrols hunting him. Garibaldi wins if he succeeds in reaching the safe point and can run away, otherwise the Austrian patrols win if they catch Garibaldi.

In turns, using the cards, it's possible to move on the gameboard, a big-sized board that reproduces accurately a map of the territory at that time. The player who controls Garibaldi, with the help of a special screen, makes his moves secretly, while the other players have to work together to stop the moves of the escaper, trying to find him.

Garibaldi: La Trafila is a game of deduction and bluff, recommended for all families: the rules are simple, but the gameplay stimulates reasoning and cooperation, offering the possibility for expert players to adopt more refined strategies.
28739.name: Garibaldi: The Escape

28740.description:
Djarhun is a world in peril. The evil wizard Gharad has stolen the Book of Avrakar and has unleashed many creatures throughout the land. In a desperate hope, the King of Elidor is seeking the help of a few brave adventurers to recover this book and return it to Elidor in the hopes that the City's mage may put an end to the evil that runs amok throughout the land. Others, of vile morality, seek to take the Book to the Gypsies in a hope of finding its secrets for their own evil purpose. You are one of these adventurers that seek the Book. Along the way, you will encounter many perils and much treasure. You will gain new friends and meet helpful strangers. When you are strong enough, you will travel to the Abyss, where you will fight Gharad in a battle that may decide the fate of Djarhun.

Djarhun is a fantasy board game that can be played by up to 6 players. As players move around the board, they will find items, and slay monsters, that will increase their power. When a player is powerful enough, they may head for the center of the board and try to claim the Book of Avrakar. Whoever brings the Book to the predetermined location, is the victor.

Expanded by:

Ruined Urthe: A Djarhun Expansion
Goblin Invasion: A Djarhun Expansion
28740.name: Djarhun

28741.name: TV Week TV Trivia Board game
28741.description:
From the publisher's website:

Are you a TV Trivia expert? Test you knowledge of TV and you're friends with the TV Week TV Trivia Board game. The ultimate for TV lovers. It includes questions in 5 categories on all you're favourite TV shows, old and new, as well as Australia's glamour television event, the TV Week Logie awards.

The TV Week Gold Logie Award goes to...

28742.name: Why Not?
28742.description:
From the back cover: "Why Not? is the magnetized board game that's like a card game and word game rolled into one! Use the four different colored alphabets to make set of three and four of the same letter. Make "runs" in alphabetical order. Or spell words using all one color. The more letters you use each turn, the higher you score. It's a constant challenge!

OBJECT: Score high by using as many letters as possible each turn, and adding their total point values to your running score. To win, you must be the first one to use up all your letters or spell the words "Why Not?"

1992 Mensa Select

28743.name: Stilbruch
28743.description: An artful matching game, in a stylish tin with small tiles with black and white photos of either famous chair designs or cultural iconic moments in time. Try and match the chair with the times.

28744.name: Le Négocio
28744.description:
Le Négocio is a mix of Monopoly and Trivial pursuit with a social mission : sensibilise childrens to the Fair Trade.

The objective of the game is to get 5 Fair Trade goods and 5 coffee warehouses.

28745.name: Warrior Dice
28745.description:
This is a dice game for 2 players.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Players are warriors that fight each other using dice.
Use the tables to see what's the meaning of the die result.
While attacking and defending don't forget to see your Life Points! If they are reduced to 0 then you have lost.

28746.name: WarFair
28746.description:
This is a cardgame for 2 to 6 players.
Players are Army Sellers that only see money in their life!
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Use the right combinations of Army/Nation to sell the best army at the higher profit.
But be aware... CIA, FBI and INTERPOL are always on your traces.

28747.name: Transformers Skirmish
28747.description:
This is a board/card game for 2 players.
One player is the Autobots and the other one is the Decepticons.
Transformers is a trademark logo and this is a merely fan project, created for fun.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
To win you have to defeat all the enemy transformers.
To play you need a 8x8 square board and the appended cardset.
Movements, attacks and defences are all card-driven.

28748.name: Tournament
28748.description:
This is a cardgame for 2+ players.
Players compete to win Medieval Tournaments.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
To do this they have to set up a lot of combinations of: Horse, Army, Shield and Soldier.
Different Torunament needs different combinations.

28749.name: Thermopylae
28749.description:
This is a cardgame for 2 players set during the Thermopylae battle (480 BC).
One player represent Spartans and the other one Persians.
Each palyer has a dedicated deck with specific cards.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
If you chose to be the Spartans... draw cards and defend yourself because Persians are the only one who can attack.

28750.name: Ships of the Line
28750.description:
This is a cardgame for 2 player.
It's a war between ships of the period XV-XVII sec.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Every ship has values for: Ship, Ropes, Equipment.
Move your ship fast and be the first to hit down enemy ship.
To win you have to reduce one of the characteristic of opponent ship to 0.

28751.name: Bonk! The Game of Naughty Words
28751.description:
Similar to Balderdash or Call My Bluff, except focusing on words that are (or sound like they could be) "naughty" - generally relating to reproduction, fidelity, anatomy, and amorous activities. Three options are given, but unlike the two aforementioned games, in Bonk! players do not elaborate or make up definitions.

For example, which of the following does "Basifugal" mean?

Chaste, after St. Basil.
Turning away from a kiss.
Unable to bear children.




Players start with 3 points, represented by tiddlywinks (white = 1 point, black = 2 points).

Players take turns to be question master, reading out a word and three definitions. Other players display which they think is correct by holding up the appropriate number card. Players who are wrong give 1 point to the question master.

Players are out of the game when they run out of tiddlywinks. The objective is to get all the tiddlywinks (or in 4+ game, the most tiddlywinks in the final two).

82 cards each contain 4 different words, 2 on front and 2 on back.

28752.name: Atomic Business
28752.description:
Each player controls diplomats trying to sign a nuclear contract with the democratic republic of Nasombia.

The first player that successfully brings a nuclear contract in his briefcase wins the game, many briefcases are fakes to trick opponents.

28753.name: Caribé
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
28753.description:
Set in the Caribbean in 1590, Caribé is a game of pure strategy, permitting players to hide certain information in the form of stowaways on their ships, while striving to use their limited settlers with as much efficacy as possible. Each imperial power specializes in a different type of unit, each unit having different uses on the islands. Caribé allows the players to manipulate the turn order in order to take advantage of the transit times of their ships. To add yet more variety to the game, each island is of different worth to the different players.

Design Awards


Special Prize - Best Full-Length Game 2007 Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb
Finalist 2006 Concours International de Créateurs de Jeux de Société
Finalist 2006 Premio Archimede

28755.description:
The goal of the game is to speak the Die Sprache Des Manitu language

Each turn the players draw a card and read loudly the syllable, each new turn a new syllable is added and the player must say it without error.

from the publisher´s site:
"Ma-Ni-Tu (The dodgy syllable game)
All the Indians pay attention to the chief who shows the first card. The first Indian reads it out loud: "HO". The chief inserts it in the card holder so that the others cannot see it and the second card is drawn. The second Indian repeats "Ho" and adds "TI" for the second card. The wise chief verifies, if anyone makes a mistake. Who can remember the longest word in Manitou's language?"
28755.name: Die Sprache des Manitu
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 12 – Drei Magier Spiele – Neuheiten Frühjahr 2007

28756.name: Dungeonrunner
28756.description:
Dungeonrunner is the solitaire game of going on an adventure, defeat various foes, avoid perilous traps, solve mystical riddles, and somehow, make it out alive.

D10 not included

28757.name: Des thunes et des urnes
28757.description:
This is a satirical game about French politics.

The players try to be the next president of France by buying votes and bluffing.

28759.name: Dead Pan
28759.description:
Object of the game is to win by being the first player to clear all the marbles out of the 6 oblong pans in his/her own tray, OR to win by "default", when some other player fills all of their six penalty holes at the top of their tray.
Very mancala-like.

Description from Selchow & Righter Co. Catalog:

Just like eating Peanuts - when you play Dead Pan, you keep coming back for more. Another Winner following on the heels of Scrabble. Novel in appearance, new in method of play and easy - so easy to learn. Nothing to do but drop Marbles into the beautiful plastic trays - but it's a real Challenge to WIN. For all ages.

Contents:

In beautiful modern box 16 3/8" X 9 3/4" X 2" containing four colored plastic trays, 72 colored marbles, short easy-to-read directions in the box cover.

28760.description:
The ultimate game in adventure along with the danger of black magic. On your quest for victory, you follow a dangerous trail constantly at the mercy of chance and evil. Such dangers as the TOWER, the gateway to the maze of tunnels beneath you, and the supreme evil of the PHANTOM BALL conspire to end your travels. Depending on how destiny treats you, you may be the victor or just an observer.

THE TOWER
It holds the key to your destiny. It can help you or destroy you. It acts on pure chance, it holds no favorites. Once you enter, your exit may not be what you expected.

PHANTOM BALL
It draws its power from the evil in black magic, It's attacks are unpredictable and savagely quick. Once unleashed, it has only one purpose, to destroy your player.
28760.name: Phantom Ball

boardgamepublisher: Dinner and a Murder Mystery Games LLC
28761.description:
from the Publisher's website:

Murder At The Four Deuces is a rip roaring 1920's gangster murder mystery party game with lots of murder, bribery & back stabbing to be had.

This game is loosely based on some of the very first Chicago & New York Gangsters, their rivalries, speakeasies and love lives. Al Capone was just moving up in the 'Family'.

Don and MeMe Wannabe are hosting the grand opening celebration for their new Juice Joint, The Four Deuces, and you are invited to attend. The Four Deuces is a lavish joint serving booze and music in the front. In the back is the game room and upstairs is a very high class and exclusive brothel (no brothel in the teen rated version). The cream and not so cream of society will be here. With gangsters, politicians, dolls, molls and many other interesting guests in attendance this event is sure to be the bee's knees.

Home Page: http://www.dinnerandamurder.com/games/4deuces.htm
28761.name: Murder at the Four Deuces
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 42 - Pirate Den

28762.description: This expansion map to Hansa gives players new opportunities to ship goods among the Hanseatic League. It also allows players to move the ship against the arrows on the board at a cost of 2 gold, and it adopts the additional endgame scoring mechanisms seen in Hansa Extrakarte.
boardgameversion: Spiele aus Timbuktu German first edition
28762.name: Hansa: Changing Winds

28763.description: An early wargame on the War of 1812.
28763.name: New Orleans, 1815

28764.name: Sa'vant
28764.description:
Sa'vant appears to be a Code 777 or Headbanz light. Players are dealt a card and without looking at it put it in the holder in front of them, where other players can see it. Then the play moves clockwise in three "sets" where players make guesses about their card.

In the first "set", players guess as to what position their card may be -- Highest, 2d Highest, 2d Lowest, or Lowest. In the second set, a player again makes a guess as to what position his or her card may be (and a player may change his or her guess from the first set), and also makes three guesses as to which card he or she may hold. In the third set, a player makes a guess as to exactly what his or her card is.

Points are determined as thus:

1st Set - 1 point for accurate position guessed
2nd Set - 1 point for accurate position guessed
1 point for Exact card held being one of the three guesses

3rd Set - 3 points for exact card guessed.

28765.name: The Colonists of Natick
28765.description:
Two players compete to colonize the newfound Island of Natick. A player earns victory points by expanding their colony: constructing new villages and towns, and employing traders and knights. The first colony to reach 7 victory points (VPs) will dominate the island and the local music scene.

This game is a port of Klaus Teuber's Settlers of Catan Card Game to the piecepack system. It won the Good Portsmanship piecepack design contest in March 2007.

28766.name: Take Off, Eh!
28766.description:
Increase your political prestige (score points) by funding pork barrel projects, paying bribes and pushing your own agenda, especially in areas where the people will most appreciate what you're trying to do.

This game is a port of El Grande, and was an entry to the Good Portsmanship piecepack design contest in March 2007.

28767.name: Equalz
28767.description: Using a deck that contains both digit cards and arithmetic operation cards(addition, subtraction, multiplication, division), players attempt to current target number by creating a mathematical expression that equals that target number. A round ends when 1 or more players use all of their cards making expressions. The first player to reach 500 points wins.

28768.name: Bay of Pigs
28768.description:
Operation simulation of the 1961 invasion of Cuba, by the designer of Schutztruppe.
Amphibious landings, unit disruptions, supply limitations, air and naval bombardment.
Fairly easy to play and fast-moving. 176 counters

28771.name: Teletubbies Colorforms Stick-On Game
28771.description: Ages 3 and up. The Tubbies have said their famous bye-byes but want to come back and do it again. Collect the teletubbies. When you have them all, the game is over.

28772.name: Castile
28772.description:
If you like a subtle game of strategy, you and your opponent will love being engaged in the game of Castile.

A square board, divided into five territories, provides the battle area in which players attempt to capture three of the territories and place their flag. The first player to capture three territories wins.

Reimplemented by:
Turnier
Claim

28773.name: Barbie Miss Lively Livin
28773.description:
In this game, players can play either Barbie or one of her 3 friends.

As they travel around the board, players collect charms for their bracelets. Once a player has collected 2 of each type of charm (there are 5 types), that player may enter the "Miss Lively Livin" pageant. The first to be crowned "Miss Lively Livin" is the winner.

Ages 8 - 12.

28774.description:
In this TCG, humans fight to capture the Dinosaurs that awoke of his millenarian lethargy and are putting the city in danger.

You must capture 4 Dinosaurs to be declared the winner. The exciting thing of Cazaurio is that no game is equal to the previous one. A game of Cazaurio, represents the fight of the man to survive against the powerful dinosaurs that have returned to populate the Earth. You control a group of dinosaur hunters called Cazaurios, which compete with the team of your opponent to demonstrate that they are the best ones hunting the old reptiles.

A deck of Cazaurio is composed with 30 card. You also have 5 dinosaur cards that are not mixed with the deck

There are 4 card types:
1. – Saurio (dinosaurs)
2. – Cazaurio (hunters)
3. – Equipment
4. - Adventure
28774.name: Cazaurio (CCG)

28775.description: Frontier: Blood on the Plains is the first supplement for Legends of the Old West. Now you can re-enact battles between the US Cavalry and the Plains Indians, or ride with the infamous Texas Rangers. Re-write the history books by siding with legendary figures of this bloody conflict, such as Crazy Horse and George Armstrong Custer. Experience the power of an organized cavalry charge, or earn your eagle-feathers by riding with the Sioux – there will be no quarter asked and none given!
28775.name: Frontier: Blood on the Plains

28776.description:
The second V-Mail Postcard Game, UNTERNEHMUNG 25, chronicles the Axis invasion of Yugoslavia in 1941. The basic game system is similar to the of its predecessor, Malaya. New elements include German mountain troops, Panzer Corps, air support, and the bombing of Belgrade, as well as the effects of mountain and river terrain. Hungarian and Italian troops also make an appearance.

Can you, as the Germans, make a lightning-fast assault and capture Belgrade in time to release units for the upcoming invasion of Russia? As the Yugoslavs, can you derail the German timetable and buy time for the Allies to react? It's all up to you.

18 counters at the Corps and Army level and a full-color map of Yugoslavia- all on a 5x8 inch postcard!

In a small series with Malaya: V-Mail Postcard Game #1.
28776.name: Unternehmung 25: V-Mail Postcard Game #2

28777.name: Karamo
28777.description:
Similar to Jenga but instead of stacking a player tries to draw or push as many sticks as possible out of the pile of wooden sticks with the sliding stick. Whilst doing this the other sticks are not allowed to move & if they do the player has to put it back on the top of the pile & it is the next player's turn.

The winner is determined by points achieved by capturing different sized logs.

Similar to:

Fire
Log Jam

28778.name: Rhino Rush
28778.description:
Throughout the game the Rhino rushes about the board either pushing the poor Looney birds back along the track or knocking them over.

The first player to get both of their colour Looney birds to the safety of the tall grass wins the game.

Similar to Dizzy Dizzy Dinosaur except the Rhino is battery powered !

28779.description:
An add-on to the Rise of the Luftwaffe series, depicts the battle for the Kuban Bridgehead, over the river Kuban, it was the last German holding in the Caucasus.

This module is found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr #11 and is available for download from here.

Expands:

Rise of the Luftwaffe
28779.name: Down In Flames: Kuban Bridgehead

28780.name: Starslavers
28780.description: STARSLAVERS is a game of strategic space exploration with tactical combat where interplanetary press gangs "recruit" aliens for arena combat.

28782.description: Place your spinning tops in front of your station and crash your opponent. First player to 10 marks is the winner.
28782.name: Spin To Win Game

28783.name: Brain Quest Know the States! Geography Game
28783.description: From the publisher: How well do you know the states? Well, you're about to learn all about American geography and culture in a really fun way! With questions designed by grade level, children from 3rd grade - 7th grade can all play this game together on a level playing field. Players move around the map game board and answer questions about cities, states, lakes, rivers, oceans, national parks, crops, industries, and more. When they answer a question correctly, they'll earn that state's flag. The first player to collect 6 state flags, wins the game. It's an exciting and educational trivia game that makes learning USA geography lots of fun! Comes with 440 Questions, Game Board, State Flag Tokens, Score Cards, 4 Pawns, Die, and Game Instructions. For 2 or More Players, Ages 8 and up.

28784.description:
Battlefield is a Chinese Stratego rip-off, but with some differences. For a start, each player has 44 pieces instead of 40. There are half a dozen unit count differences, plus a different rank name. Additionally, instead of lower rank number defining victory, the piece with the highest points wins.

Flag; 0 points, 1 piece
Marshal; 15 points, 1 piece
General; 10 points, 1 piece
Colonel; 9 points, 3 pieces
Major; 8 points, 4 pieces
Captain; 7 points, 5 pieces
Lieutenant; 6 points, 5 pieces
Sergeant; 5 points, 5 pieces
Miner; 4 points, 4 pieces
Soldier; 3 points, 9 pieces
Spy; 2 points, 1 piece
Bomb; 1 point, 5 pieces

I'm yet to find any significant rules differences from Stratego.

The game itself is "travel friendly". That is to say that it uses a plastic box where the lid flips over to reveal the playing board, though it's pushing the definition of "travel-sized". The instructions are on the back of the packaging.

There are no credits or dates anywhere on the packaging or game, just "Made in China". It is apparently "Item No. 3313".
boardgameversion: Travel edition with 24 pieces per player
28784.name: Battlefield

28785.name: Monty's Maze
28785.description: Monty's Maze creates an irresistible adventure of challenge and excitement. Build an expedition and take it into the mysterious maze to uncover the treasures of ancient tombs. Watch out of the rope bridge, the dark chamber, and the bat cave! Outrun the Keloy Monsters! Escape from marauding opponents! Unload your treasure and go back for more. If you can secure 3 golden masks, you win!

28786.name: Ready Fence
28786.description:
This is a cardgame for 2 players.
Players are fencing athletes fighting each other.
Players share a common deck and use cards to Move, Attack and to Defend.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
The winner is the one who reaches 5 (or 15) points.

28787.name: Phoenician Sea Trader
28787.description:
Card and Board game for 2+ players.
Players represents sea trader of Ancient Times.
They have to buy and sell different materials (Oils, Spices, Silk, etc).
Some City Ports pay well for specific types of materials and some other Ports sell them for high prices.
Travel with your ship across the board but be aware of Tornadoes and Pirates.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
The winner is the one who collects 25 money. (earned with trades).

28788.name: Naval Duel
28788.description:
Tactical fight between ships (1700-1800)
On an hexagonal squared map every player fights using his 7 ships.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Ships have different specifications (speed, agility, fire, cannons, captain, etc.) so be aware who you are attacking.
The winner is the one who defeats all the other ships.

28790.name: Lions and Gladiators
28790.description:
This is a dice/board game for 2 players.
You are in the Roman Coliseum fighting for life.
You player is the Gladiators and the other one is the Lions.
All you need is a 8x8 square board and 2d6.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.

28791.name: Jerusalem 70AD
28791.description:
This is a cardgame for 2 players.
It's set during the Hebrew revolt in the Roman province of Judea.
Every player has a dedicated card set.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Draw, Reinforce, Fight and Retreat.
Be the smartest and most powerful in order to achieve victory during 8 different assaults.

28792.name: Javelin
28792.description:
This is a cardgame for 2+ players.
As you can imagine by the name of the game... you compete to throw the javelin as far as you can.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Draw and play your cards. (every card has a value on it).
You can combine cards from different types (1 for each type)
- start
- run
- run in pose
- pose
- throw
you decide the sequence and the number of throws.
The winner is the one with the higher throw-total.

28793.description:
This is a cardgame for 4 players.
