28899.description: A solitaire game simulating the colonization of Mars. The player takes control of space colony, with a main goal of expanding the colony to 2000 colonists. Over time, the player has random events like disease, meteor storms and so much more to deal with!

28900.description:
As the year 1944 ends, the Allied Army dominated almost all of the Italian Peninsula, but in the North, the valley of the Pó river was still in German hands.

Those German troops were either depleted or were being removed for other fronts, and with few replacements available; the Luftwaffe already did not dare to appear; the logistic situations were chaotic; the imminent defeat decreased the German´s Moral and the end was coming.

On the other side, the Allies were strengthened, receiving continuous reinforcements, the moral was high and the situation in Europe was changing. The end of war was a near reality, but when?

On September 12, 1944, the Allies launched an assault with its main objective as the city of Bologna, an important center of communications in the valley of the Pó. If Bologna fell, the Allies would advance to Austria, isolating the remainder of the German armies still in Italy. Blocking one of the roads was a set of hills, and between these hills, was Mount Castle, the main objective of the 1ª Division of Infantry of the Brazilian Expeditionary Force

1 Large map - 6 11x17 sections (print-n-play also comes with 12 8.5x11 sections)
9 Page Rules
1 Tables Chart
9 Page Historical Notes
191 counters and 3 special counters

Home Page: http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/mc.htm (Portugese)
Home Page: http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/english/mc2.htm (English)

Print-n-Play version at:
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=570 * * * Removed from sale 1/13/10
28900.name: Monte Castelo and Gothic Line

28901.name: Reading and Writing: The Toronto Research Game
28901.description:
"Reading and Writing" is a simulation of what the Toronto Research Group goes through writing *their* essays. Now you can experience the excitement of the competitive search for knowledge as you vie with other players to find and read books that will help you garner the groundbreaking might into the process of READING and WRITING. In the campaign version of the game, you'll have a chance to build a REPUTATION as the *real* thinker in the Toronto Research Group!

Published in Steve McCaffery and bpNichol, Rational Geomancy: The Kids of the Book-Machine (Vancouver: Talonbooks, 1992).

28902.name: The Bodleian Game
28902.description:
Evoking memories of hours spent in scholarly pursuit, players are given a subject of research and told to compile a bibliography made up from books to be found in the Bodleian and its dependent libraries.

Throughout the game 'readers' are confronted with the familiar frustrations of finding a book that is 'out to another reader' or 'not in place' and with having to deal with such distractions as being tempted away from work into the Kings Arms.

This unique and entertaining game comprises a set of 102 cards (the rules say 105, but are incorrect), each portraying a different book; a board representing the libraries and their reading rooms; and chance cards and playing pieces for up to six participants.

28903.name: Jump Jet
28903.description:
A very rare game where the players pilot aircraft in flight formations making attacks & returning to base.

The game is easy to setup and quick to play.

Players must assemble their own colour of aircraft & return via the flight path designated.

The winner is the first player to return all of his flight to base.

28904.name: Island Trader
28904.description:
A very rare game that mixes the travel of Capital Adventure with the trading of The Business Game a.k.a. Mine a Million.

However the game is easier to setup and quicker to play.

Players must journey from island to island by ship, avoiding pirates & collecting cargo.

The winner is the first player to return to the center island with all four cargoes of fruit.

28905.name: Dostihy a sázky
28905.description:
A classic Czech pre-revolution monopoly clone.
Buy horse champions and place them in your stable. Earn money when other players visit your stable, lose money when you visit theirs. Hire trainers, draw cards of luck and finances, place bets on horses. Last player not bankrupt wins the game.
One of few "modern" board games available before 1989 revolution in former Czechoslovakia. Along with Sorry!, Stratego and Scotland Yard clones a typical household feature.

28906.description:
The goal of Top 15 is to align 15 counters ascending from 1 to 15. The quicker player wins.

Each player gets a small board with 3x 5 pits where the plastic counters will be placed face down (well mixed before). Ready, set, go! Both players are allowed to look the number of one counter and then to put it back. Only if they find the number one they may put it into a guideway to mark progress. Then they go on with number two, three etc.

To make it more difficult, players are only allowed to use one hand (the other holds the board).
This game was designed to train memory skills as well as fine-tune motor abilities.
boardgameversion: MB Spiele Half Yellow Box Edition
28906.name: Top 15

28907.description:
From the publisher's website:

"B-29 Superfortress is a solitaire game featuring the technologically most advanced bomber of the Second World War - the B-29 - flying as part of the Twentieth Air Force from the Marianas Islands against targets in and around Japan in late 1944 and 1945.

The game puts you in the cockpit of a B-29 Superfortress as you fly your missions over Japan. Your goal: successfully complete a tour of 35 missions and return home a hero for bringing the war with Japan to a close without a bloody hard-fought invasion of the homeland.

Your missions will be varied: high level, low level, day and night. You will face fighter attacks, flak, searchlight spotting, and bad weather; not to mention damage to your aircraft to include a shattered windshield and compromised cabin pressure, loss of oxygen supply, damaged landing gear, knocked out navigation or communication equipment, ruptured fuel tanks, inoperable machine gun armament, and just about anything else that can go wrong with a 100 ton aircraft flying 1,500 miles to its target only to be met with fierce resistance from a determined enemy."
28907.name: B-29 Superfortress
boardgamepodcastepisode: Chickens in the Backyard
Point 2 Point 32: Prezcon 2008 and Rick Young

28908.description:
An expansion to Federation Commander: Academy and part of the Federation Commander Series of products.

This product contains the parts of Federation Commander: Klingon Border which is not found in Federation Commander: Academy. The purpose is for people who bought the lower cost demonstration product Federation Commander: Academy to be able to easily upgrade to the complete game. Included are the one-inch counters, six-hard mounted map boards, and 14 ship cards.
28908.name: Federation Commander: Graduation

28909.name: Spring Chicken
28909.description:
From the box cover:
Spin a marble around the nest
put it on a feather or two
Oops... Be careful
SPRING CHICKEN has a surprise for you!

Ages 5 - 12.

28910.name: Bible Blurt: The Card Game
28910.description: Don’t think long and hard think fast and fun! It’s time to play Bible Blurt - The Card Game! Find out if your brain can keep up with your mouth and if your mouth can keep up with your brain! The words are taken from the NIV of the Bible and the play of the game is lightning quick. Relax and enjoy all the funny things people blurt! Ages 8 and up, 3 to 5 Players. 312 Bible Blurt definitions on 52 cards

28911.name: Proverbial Wisdom: Bible Edition
28911.description: Proverbial Wisdom Bible Challenges players to sketch a proverb for teammates to guess, choose the correct meaning or origin of a proverb, or guess what proverb a pre-drawn picture represents. Players have sixty seconds to preform! 500 proverbs, familiar sayings and expressions are included. Ages 10 and up, 4 to 16 Players

28912.name: Salvation Challenge Boardgame
28912.description: Salvation Challenge is a great new family game. Each player starts out with one million in kingdom cash. Players get saved by landing on Calvary and making the salvation call, “Jesus Save Me”. Players then enter a race to be first to give all of the kingdom cash to missionaries to further God’s Kingdom. The first player to get saved and give all their kingdom cash to the missionaries wins. Ages 10 and up, 2 to 6 Players

28916.name: The Wind in the Willows Game
28916.description:
Each player plays as either Ratty, Mole, Toad, or Badger. The object of the game is to collect and deliver presents to your friends and then be the first to make it back home.

2 to 4 players Ages 5 - 11.

28917.name: Trader
28917.description:
A promotional game developed by MeesPierson in cooperation with Identity Games.

from the rule booklet:

Trader is a dynamic board game that embraces every element of the commodity trade. The players become traders and discover whether they are experts at doing business efficiently. Trader is about making money through well-timed buying and selling of loads of commodities. Discover the strategic world of the commodity trade!

28918.name: The Hill
28918.description: From GAMES Magazine: The grass always seems greener on the other side of this six-level hill, so everyone's going over the top to win by reaching four enemy bases there. Dice rolls determine movement. You can jump single enemies (except uphill) and flip them over to become yours. A piece landing on the summit becomes a Field Marshal, which cannot be jumped but may leap and convert entire rows of enemies. However, there can only be one Field Marshal, whose allegiance proves difficult to retain; it must vacate the sacred peak immediately, allowing others to reach it and wrest control. Things can get hectic, but patiently blocking upwardly mobile forces in order to keep the fickle Field Marshal loyal usually wins. Still, this is a feisty game that can literally be enjoyed at all levels.

28919.name: Squominos
28919.description:
This is a tie-in to the 2005 Charlie and the Chocolate Factory movie.

Each Squomino has an Oompa-Loompa in a colored uniform on each of its four sides. Players link pairs of matching Oompa-Loompas by placing the Squominos in a spiral shape.

Players start with 7 Squominos. If they cannot play a Squomino on their turn, they pick one up from the pool. The winner is the first to run out of Squominos.

Therefore the choice is which Squomino to use, not where.

There are 58 Squominos, including 3 wild cards (which can match anything). Oompa-Loompas are in just four colors: green, red, yellow and blue.

This simplicity makes the game suitable for Ages 3 and up.

28920.name: Wellington's War: The Peninsular Campaign 1809-1814
28920.description:
WELLINGTON'S WAR presents the entire Peninsular Campaign using wooden blocks on one 32 inch by 48 inch map. The 12 six-month turns cover 1808 to 1814. The 100 blocks represent the military forces ofGreat Britain, Spain, Portugal, and France.

Combat involves dice rolling for hits (No CRT or Battle board needed). The Supply and logistic rules are meant to model the Peninsular War adage that: "In Spain large armies starve, and small ones get beaten". Winter attrition in the wrong areas can be brutal. Control of areas is key to victory and the French player in particular will contend with conflicting needs of garrisoning key areas while maintaining a sufficiently strong field force.

The map covers Spain, Portugal, and southern France at about 35 miles to the hex. Depicted are the various provinces (rated for political and supply value), the major rivers, mountain ranges, and the key fortresses and towns. Each turn represents 6 months of real time (12 turns in game) and is broken down into Event, Operations, and Administrative phases.

The wooden blocks represent the major military formations that took part in the war generally depicted as Spanish field armies, French divisional and corp sized formations, Anglo-Portuguese divisions, and British expeditionary forces. Leaders include Wellington, Moore, Soult, and even a special guest appearance by Napoleon himself. Special blocks include Major guerrilla formations, The Lines of Torres Vedras, Popham's Naval Squadron, and key fortress garrisons.

A set of 30 event cards allows for random events, historical chrome, and political background. They also help regulate the various nation's force levels in the game. A sampling includes: "The Convention of Cintra", "Supreme Junta", "The Emperor Strikes Back", and "Russian". War. The game also includes 30 operations cards.

The game has a 12 turn Campaign game scenario, a five turn short game scenario, and a set of optional rules that provide more chrome or can be used to favor one side or the other.

Go to www.justplain.com for the publisher's website.

28921.name: WordBURST
28921.description:
Players divide into two teams, and take turns trying to come up with as many word association matches in a given category as possible, scoring points for correct matches. The game ends when either team reaches a predetermined score, or when a predetermined time limit is reached.

There are four categories:

Visual Imagery: Try to come up with as many items as you can from the list on the card before your time runs out. (Example: Things you see in a mall")

Synonyms: Try to come up with the indicated synonym for each entry in a list of words. (Example: given the word "talk", come up with the word "speak"; given the word "big", come up with the word "large")

Word Association: Try to come up with as many associated words as you can from the list on the card before your time runs out. (Example: Come up with words associated with the word "beach")

Sound/Letter Cueing: Try to come up with the indicated item from the list on the card, given the initial letter or sound of the word. (Example: Things that are soft - starts with the letter "m" (marshmallows); starts with the "f" sound (fur))

28922.name: Limeys & Slimeys
28922.description: This Age of Sail "beer and pretzel" miniatures game was designed to be a simple game of naval warfare.

28923.name: Hannibal: The War of the Kings
28923.description:
The game is played on an 8x8 grid. Each opponent has 1 king, and they share 9 pieces of each of 5 colours.

Each turn, a player moves their king 1 space orthogonally or diagonally and adds 1 coloured block to the board. The first player to surround the opponent's king wins.

The advanced version allows a player to escape if there are two pieces of the same colour adjacent to the king. The game continues until no such escape is possible.

28924.name: Gold Medal
28924.description:
In Gold Medal, each player manages a team of four athletes, who will compete in four races: one jump, one throw and two runs. Each athlete participates in one of these races. At the end of the game, the entire team will participate in the most important race: the 4x100 relay.

In the first phase of the game, players must train their teams, using their money to improve an athletes skill and to get cards.

At the end of the training phase, the races begin.
Taking turns, one player rolls the dice, and all the athletes involved in the race (both the rolling player's and every one elses) move on the board according on the dice result, the athlete's skill and the played cards.

At the end of the relay, the team who has won the best medals is the winner.

28925.name: Operation Fischfang Smashing the Allies at Anzio February 1944
28925.description:
Operation Fischfang(Fish Trap) depicts the German operation starting on Feb.16th, 1944 to destroy the Allied invasion landing at Anzio. The 76th Panzer Korps almost pushed the Allies back to the sea but was stopped by a desperate counterattack by the 6th Corps backed up by massive air and naval support. Both sides were quite exhausted by the end of the fighting.

The game has 280 counters, uses the same system as Nanawa: Verdun in the Chaco War, July 1933 complete with air and artillery rules, weather etc. 9 pages of rules.

28926.name: Blackjack Dice Game
28926.description: This is a fun way to play Blackjack! This set includes two 10-sided dice for the Blackjack game and three regular spotted dice (numbered 1 - 6) for the C-Low & Craps games.

28927.name: HeroZero
28927.description:
HeroZero is a fast-paced, action packed card game. To win HeroZero you race to beat your opponent by collecting a complete set of cards.
All that is needed is contained in a single deck.

28928.name: Roller Chase
28928.description:
Roller Chase
The wildest race ever!
Get on for the Ride!
Board Game for ages 7 & up
2 - 4 players
Playing board 10½" x 10½"

Object of the game: Be the first to go around the track, collet all four flags and return to your starting point.

This game comes in a small box with all the components in a yellow ziplock baggie. The board is 6 pieces that fit together like a jigsaw. Also included are one die, 12 stands, 12 cardboard figures (4 players (green and red girls, blue and yellow boys, in roller coaster cars) and 8 grey wild cars), and 4 flags of each colour (blue, red, green, yellow) on a perforated piece of cardboard.

Each player starts in one of the four corner starting points according to the colour of the roller coaster car that they have chosen. Two wild cars (grey) per player are placed anywhere else on the track. Each player takes turns rolling the die and moving *BOTH* their playing piece *AND* any one of the wild cars the number of spaces indicated by the die. Wild cars bump player cars back 6 spaces. Reach all four corners, pick up one flag of each colour, and get back to the starting point before anyone else does.

28929.name: What's Cooking?: The Ultimate Party Game for Cooks, Foodies & Friends
28929.description:
From the box: "Whether you're a true food fanatic or just like to cook, this party game will have everyone laughing. Each of the five categories What's cookin'?, What's a spatula?, Melting Pot, Renowned Restaurants, and Foodie First are so diverse that no matter what you're good at, each dinner guest will be a star."

A variable length party game in which two teams try their hand at the five categories:
What's Cookin'?- guess the dish from the ingredient list
What's a Spatula?- draw the specified kitchen tool and have your teammates guess
Melting Pot- Determine where a dish originated
Renowned Restaurants- Choose the city where a restaurant is located (multiple choice)
Foodie First- write down as many items that you can that within the category given.

Each team gets an equal amount of turns until the food is ready

28930.name: McDonald's McNugget Buddies Masquerade Ball Game
28930.description: 2 to 4 players Ages 3 and up each pretend to be one of the McNugget Buddies getting ready to go to the Masquerade Ball. Players practice counting as they collect pieces of their fancy costume. But hurry. If you're not home by midnight you turn back into a plain McNugget Buddy.

28931.name: Achi
28931.description:
Achi is a traditional game from Ghana. It is played on a 3x3 board.

There are two versions to this game. In one version, each player has four pieces to drop. In another version, each player has only three pieces to drop, which makes it identical to Tapatan.

The objective is to place all 3 of your tokens in a row. Players take turns placing the tokens on the board. If neither player has achieved 3 in a row after all tokens are on the board, they take turns moving a token along one of the lines until a winner is determined.

28932.name: Trojano
28932.description: A spin and move racing game from the 1920's by Chad Valley. Comes with a playing board with built-in spinner, and miniature cars for player tokens.

28933.name: Plane Game
28933.description: This game is hard to get any details on... It was commercially produced and is in the Smithsonian Udvar-Hazy Aviation Museum extension at Dulles Airport. Given its age and craftsmanship, I have placed the age at 1925. The airplanes actually similar the Spirit of St Louis, but the game bears no resemblance to trying to cross the Atlantic. You use magnets to "fling" an airplane against another magnet on the "wall" at the far side. In the 4 photos (to be uploaded) are the board and shots of the suspended magnet used in flying the airplanes.

28935.description:
from the publishers:

It started out as just another friendly night at Nick's Cocktail Lounge. The Piano man was playing softly over the low din of conversation. But, he wasn't the only entertainment… there were also the colorful characters at the bar, providing an intriguing atmosphere. They could have kept you entertained, all night long.

But, who would have known, tonight, the main attraction would be – murder!

Each murder mystery party game comes equipped with:


A complete Party Planner with instructions, costume suggestions and an optional dinner menu
Invitations and name tags for your guests
Character profiles with secret clues and backgrounds
An audio CD which re-enacts the sounds of the murder and outlines the plot
The Author's Solution to the murder
28935.name: An Evening of Murder: Last Call
boardgamefamily: Max Haines invites you to An Evening of Murder

28936.name: Whale Shogi
28936.description: Whale Shogi was created by R. Wayne Schmittberger, the former editor of Games magazine. It is played on a 6x6 board, and the pieces are all named after sea mammals. Normal Shogi drop rules apply. The porpoise is the only piece that promotes. If the porpoise is captured, it must be promoted to a killer whale when it is dropped back on the board.

28937.name: Camp
28937.description:
The game takes place in the jungle where up to four teams try to fulfill the same research instructions. The player who fulfills this order first is the winner.

The game consists of one gameboard, 12 pawns, 16 cards and one rulebook with the following three languages: German/French/Italian.
Ages 8 and up

28938.name: NanoBlanks
28938.description:
From the official product page on the Looney Labs website;

NanoBlanks are packets of do-it-yourself expansion cards for Nanofictionary (much like Fluxx Blanxx are for Fluxx). Each pack contains 10 semi-blank cards for you to be creative with: 4 Characters, 2 Settings, 2 Problems, and 2 Resolutions. Buy NanoBlanks!

Each packet of NanoBlanks also includes:

The Juror Award: Now your jurors can have a real card to use when giving away their 2 points!

The Wild Idea Action: As you begin expanding your Nanofictionary deck with your own ideas, you'll need extra Action cards to keep the balance right.

The Aquarius Wildcard: This long-awaited card is for use in your Aquarius deck. It counts as one panel of all 5 elements at all times.

(Description quoted with permission from Looney Labs.)

28939.name: Alpha Bet
28939.description:
Alpha Bet is the game of poker put to words. It incorporates all the strategy and luck of poker with the skill and verbal agility of scrabble. A game for wordsmiths of all ages.

OBJECT: To obtain the highest number of points by combining the cards in your hand into a single word. The word must use two or more cards.

THE DECK: The game consists of a 102 card deck (two of which are wild cards). It contains cards from A to Z. Each card has a point value, except wild cards. (Most games do not use the wild cards but it is an option if you wish to play with wild cards).

MANNER OF PLAY: Alpha Bet may be played in any style of poker, Texas Hold-em, five card draw, seven card stud, etc.

28940.name: Largada de Campeões
28940.description:
Largada de Campeões is a dice rolling racing game.
There are two colored dice, one for vertical moves, another for horizontal moves.
Higher number indicates faster movement, which is not always the best play. Players may choose not to move one direction but if move is taken, all dice points must be used.
High luck factor, but it´s important to chose the correct moves.

28943.name: Build a Village
28943.description: Build your own colourful little village! Complete your very own village with houses, tree and cars in 6 different colours. The village on each playing board can be joined together in many different ways for more creative play. The perfect dice game for little ones. Ages 3 and up. A beautiful color game with rich components made in wood. Very simple to play and very funny for little children.

28944.description:
1873 Harzbahn is an 18xx variant set in the Harz mountain range in northern Germany. It simulates not only the (narrow-gauge) railroads in that area, but also mines and other plants. Mining in the Harz mountains suffered a major crisis in the end of the 19th century and the theme of the game is to end this crisis by connecting the mines and other plants to the railroad network - and of course by proper management of the 7 public railroad companies, 15 private mining companies, and up to 5 public mining companies.

1873 has a bunch of fundamental differences from the usual 18xx game, which makes it one of the more distant members of the family (most prominent are the totally different systems of train operations, route determination, and revenue calculation).

---

The game presents an interesting dynamic. Mines are static and need rails to move product.

The game starts with 15 independent mines struggling with horse drawn delivery. Rails are just beginning to extend track through the difficult terrain with weak and puny engines hardly better then than horse drawn wagons. What do you invest in? The rails or the mines?

Soon however some mines are connected and the profits begin to roll in. But not very efficiently for the mines as they are too fragmented and cannot get good prices for their product. The mines then join forces into mining companies. The mining companies pay better then the independent companies but have limited capital. Do you continue to reap Okay revenues or take it public. Public mining companies move quickly to acquire additional mines from their owners who reap huge profits.

New rail companies are also forming but have to struggle with purchasing routes and difficult terrain. But the mines need the track so once connected to the mines, they start turning a profit. But how do they protect their market or extend and try to expand to new markets?

Some may fail, overextended by mismanagement and greedy owners. Others with prudent management and extended routes can reap huge profits for the shareholders.
28944.name: Harzbahn 1873

28945.name: Skylark
28945.description: Object is to fill your nest card circle with matching colored birds. Match the colored sides on the three dice with three rolls to obtain one bird of the same color.

28946.description:
An expansion for Perpetual Commotion which contains 2 additional decks in silver and gold colors. When added to the base game, this allows for up to 8 players. (or 10 if you also have the Black & White expansion)

Expands:

Perpetual Commotion
28946.name: Perpetual Commotion Silver & Gold Edition Cards

28947.description:
An expansion for Perpetual Commotion which contains 2 additional decks in black and white colors. When added to the base game, this allows for up to 8 players. (or 10 if you also have the Silver & Gold expansion)

Expands:

Perpetual Commotion
28947.name: Perpetual Commotion Black & White Edition Cards

28948.name: Quadfootball
28948.description:
A fun & tactical game for all the family, involving up to four 5-a-side teams playing on the same field against each other at the same time.

Very rare numbered limited edition game.

28949.name: Anteel
28949.description:
Anteel is a rules-light but tactically serious space wargame, which is totally diceless. In fact, there are no randomizers of any kind, resulting in a game that is all about strategy, rather than luck. There is record keeping, but it's limited to the damage each ship has taken, and convenient fleet control sheets are provided. The rules are easy to master, but to play well, you'll have to be planning several moves in advance, much like in Chess or other classic strategy games.

Gameplay is quick but nail-biting as you watch to see what plans your opponent will undo with an unexpected move.

28950.name: Spindow
28950.description:
From the Publisher:

Spindow is our Spinning Wheel Strategy game. Whatever the size of your group, 2 to 4 players, this is a great game to play. Wins come quickly and play becomes strategic as winning color combinations are removed from the game board.

You spin to win. As simple as Checkers yet as intriguing as Chess, this creative design allows players of all ages to spin the color wheel and try to get a winning combination of 5 across or down.

Spindow looks so good you won't want to put it away.

Players: 2 or 4
Ages 8 - 108

28951.name: The Restless Gun Game
28951.description: Based on the 1957-1959 TV Western of the same name, this is spin-and-move game using coloured marbles as placeholders. The board uses cut-out divots to hold the marbles, and two spinners are built into the board itself. Players move their marbles around the board in a manner vaguely reminiscent of "Parchesi" or "Sorry". Specific areas on the board and the addition of play money provide some variation on the theme.

28952.name: La giostra dei draghi
28952.description: Played on a hexagonal board. Each player controls 5 mighty dragons represented by dice, aiming to capture the opponents' ones and remain the last player on the board.

28953.name: Solitaire plus Colourtaire
28953.description:
The colour layouts give this game an entirely new fascination & provide a source of endless entertainment.

After selecting one of the colour layouts & setting up the board accordingly the player moves & takes pegs as in Solitaire but with the condition that reds, yellows, greens, blues, pinks & blacks are removed in that order, pegs of any colour being completely cleared before proceeding to the next colour.

Thus the aim is to be left with a single black peg in the centre of the board.

28954.name: Quiz Game
28954.description:
An easy to play quiz game which covers subjects in line with the National Curriculum.

Subjects are Maths, Science, English, Arts & Crafts, Geography & History.

Children compete by answering questions & performing forfeits to get to the end of the board.

A fun educational game with forfeits !

28955.name: Card Ball
28955.description: This is an odd Monopoly clone, because it isn't exactly a clone. You qualify batters, make hits, score runs, and collect teams you defeat. While the board looks awfully familiar to a Monopoly board with just the spaces representing teams rather than streets, the actual implementation of the roll & move mechanic is different and there is no trading that can occur.

28956.name: Pojedynek: Dynamiczna gra szlachecka
28956.description:
Easy game for 2 players, about dueling nobles in Poland. First game from new polish publisher Styks. The goal of the game is to defeat opponent by getting him out of life counters.
This game was designed for Polish museum Palace in Wilanow.

Here you can watch promotion video about "Pojedynek": http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v5HHngYZUmw

The box contains:

6 nobles cards
2 reference cards
100 tiles: attack, defense, special
2 dice
Board
Rule book

28957.name: Game of Butterflies
28957.description: This wooden box game has a hinged lid which opens upright to reveal die-cut clowns which holds butterfly nets of wire and cheesecloth. Object of game is similar to Tiddledy Winks, you try and put tokens into these nets.

28958.name: The Red Ryder Target Game
28958.description: The game comes with a die-cut board which folds back and is placed on the box insert. The game comes with four red balls that fit into a metal spring-type catapult that shoots balls into some tee-pees and target holes which have different point allocations.

28959.name: Toonerville Trolley Game
28959.description: Based on newspaper cartoon characters of Fontaine Fox. Simple roll and move game similar to many others of the times.

28960.name: La Mansión de los Fantasmas
28960.description:
You are trapped in a haunted castle. Your goal is to be the first to leave the castle.

You have to fight all the monsters of the castle and finally to avoid Death. In your way, you can take some talismans that help you to beat the monsters.

28961.name: Warriors of the Dark Star: The Age of the Neutron Wars
28961.description:
This was the first in a series of tactical space combat games linked to Galaxy-Foundation Games' strategic Battle for Andromeda: Conflict for a Trillion Suns! series. Further games using the same rules were Duel of the Sun Slayers, Vengeance Crusaders vs. The Monads, and the probably never published Plunderers of the Planets.

Galaxy-Foundation Games licensed Taurus Games to produce the initial print run of the game (6,000 copies, according to a later GFG catalog). Whether GFG produced any further copies is unknown; at least one later game in the series included a completely rewritten Warriors of the Dark Star rulebook, but no copy of the original game with that rulebook has been seen.

From the GFG catalog (reproduced verbatim):


The Warriors of the Dark Star - in the Age of the Neutron Wars covers the Tactical aspects of the same subjects above, except that the player is concerned with the piloting of ONE ship, its intricate operations, the application of SPECIFIC SECRET WEAPONS, individually applied, ship-to-ship single combat, Tactically oriented Battles, similar to a duel between Battleships, etc.




Often "WD" games are issued immediately with a companion "BFA" game; while the BFA game has all the ships in quantity as well as specialized weapons systems, the "WD" series takes in a particular FEATURE emphasized STRATEGICALLY in RFA, and allows a "Close-Up" in-depth treatment of particular ships. Thus, a war involving 20 or 30 ships of which 12 of these units are representative of a Special Dreadnaught with unique capabilities, fighting an ENEMY with ships of unusual properties, is concentrated on. "WD" would concern itself with the broad exposition of these forces in the form of a single ship which would be cast in a series of Scenarios that would reflect the small battles occurring in ONE HEX of "BFA" to give the emotional and personal "FEEL" not of an Admiral of the Fleet, but of a Captain of one vessel, where his piloting skills and crew efficiency is most vital! This does not cover a single bizarre ship in BFA that might be of special use, but of the Main Line items that won or lost the war; the ones that carried the major burden of the battle, whose over-all effect was sufficient to provide subject matter on what ONE ship would teach players that would help them understand the LARGE view of BFA. It is also a TRAINING AID in teaching Captains in individual combat in WD to become Commanders after the TEST OF BATTLE of fleets in BFA. Of course, if popular demand requires special, and/or additional types exposed in BFA, not covered in WD to be produced, an extension kit to HD for a minor cost of $2 to $4 is printed allowing the ND kit an unlimited number of "Expansion modules"

28962.name: No Time For Sergeants
28962.description: This spin and move game is based on the 1964 ABC TV series which starred S. Jackson (Andy Griffin was the original star in the movies) as Will Stockdale. The game comes with a spinner, Goof Cards, Service Ribbons, Cone shaped markers used for the playing pieces. The object of the game is to simply get from the outside row to the inner part of the board. Goof spaces can send you back squares. You have pass/fail squares where your character needs to pass the Army physical in order to move forward.

28963.name: Hopalong Cassidy Lasso Game
28963.description: The game box contains an 8x12" painted Masonite board with 3 metal pegs attached. A 7.5" tall plastic figure in the shape of Hoppy and his horse Topper is designed with a hole in the bottom to fit on the center peg. Game also comes with two 4" tall wood pegs and three rope lassos. Object of the game is to lasso Hoppy with rings, so the game is somewhat similar to ring-toss.

28964.name: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.: The Thrush Ray-Gun Affair
28964.description: Second " Man from UNCLE" game from IDEAL (1966). The board comes with four "U.N.C.L.E." markers, 4 barns that serve as "THRUSH" hideouts, movers, crayons and decoder cards. Centerpiece of game is large "THRUSH Ray-Gun" which when wound at top, turret revolves.

28965.name: Coast Guard in Action Shooting Gallery Game
28965.description: Tin/cardboard 29" long shooting gallery. Cardboard box folds up into position. Cardboard targets, hinged to collapse when hit by toy bullets. Mechanical gun is designed like machine gun and pivots from side to side. As machine gun crank is turned, the connecting string mechanism turns the target carousel. Hitting targets score points. Most points after 10 turns wins.

28966.name: Roger Maris Action Baseball
28966.description: Game consists of metal field with spring-action bat and marble. Wood frame reads "Roger Maris" at top. Maris facsimile signature appears at bottom left. One player "pitches" the ball and the other attempts to hit it. Many holes are located in the outfield and when the ball falls into one of those holes the result of the play is determined.

28967.name: Captain Action Card Game
28967.description: Game comes with 33 playing cards plus 3 instruction cards. Cards feature various characters, including: Captain Action, Captain America, Buck Rogers, Spider-Man, Flash Gordon and The Phantom.

28968.description:
CARDS FOR POPULAR BOARD GAME
ADD THESE CARDS & GET LUCKY!

Mafiopoly is not a stand-alone game, but a deck of cards and set of optional rules to be added to Parker Brothers' Monopoly board game. Players are given the option of playing as a Mafia player (Mafioso) or a regular player (Citizen). Citizens play by the normal Monopoly rules while Mafiosi draw from the Mafia Card deck every time they pass Go. Mafiosi also have other special rules, such as the ability to grift $50 from the bank every time any player passes Go. These advantages are somewhat balanced by the innate dangers of the profession: the Mafia Cards may cause a player to fall under investigation by a Federal Grand Jury or fall victim to as assassination attempt. One of the other Mafioso players may even put out a hit on you!

There is an interesting optional rule that allows any Mafiosi to cheat, as long as they don't get caught. If they get caught, they must pay 10% of their holdings to the bank and 10% to the player who blew the whistle.

Expands:

Monopoly
28968.name: Mafiopoly

28969.name: UNO: American Kennel Club
28969.description:
This is a slight variation on the standard Uno card game, in which you try to be the first to play all the cards in your hand by matching the last discard by color, number, or card type (Wild, Draw 2, Reverse, Skip, etc.).

This version features different dogs for each number card (i.e., all the 1's have one specific dog, all the 2's have another dog, etc.), and each dog is a particular breed as recognized by the American Kennel Club.

This is packaged in one of 4 sets: Terrier Group, Sporting Group, Non-Sporting Group, and Herding Group. Each group showcases dogs from that category of the AKC.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The Best in Show card. When you play this card you name a card color (red, yellow, blue, or green). Each player draws a card from the draw deck until he draws a card of the named color. Once all players have done this the player to your left resumes by playing a card of the named color.

28970.name: Total Football
28970.description:
From the Back of the Box

Play the opposition home and away in the Total Football League.

Experience the pressures of football management as you make decisions on tactics and team selection for each fixture.

Match by Match, your team will battle against injuries and the consequences of red and yellow cards. You will have to speculate on the transfer market to strengthen your squad with foreign flair or home grown talent in an effort to stay in contention for the whole of the season.

Contents - 6 sets of Team Cards, 24 Overseas Star Cards, 8 Referee Cards, fully detailed League Table Scorepad, set of money chips and 3 dice.

28971.name: Victory Over Communism
28971.description: Players are given cards containing questions and answers about communism. Every correct answer gets a player a Slave Country card, which frees that country from Communism. Every wrong answer brings the players one year closer to 1973, the year the rules quote as when the Communists will meet their goal of world domination.

28972.name: Wordplay
boardgamecompilation: 5 Pad & Pencil Games People Love to Play
28972.description: Wordplay consists of four different crossword puzzle blocks. Each player attempts to score the greater total of points by using a limited number of letters to fill the different blocks. Players alternate forming words in one puzzle block at a time, using the letters printed beneath that block and the available letters in reserve. As a letter is used, it is crossed out and cannot be used again.

28973.name: Take Stock
28973.description:
The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player through buying and selling stocks.

The board and play resembles Monopoly. Play begins on the opening bell and $20,000 is collected each time the spot is reached. Roll & move to a space for the opportunity to purchase that company's stock. When all of a company's stock (a color group) is owned by one person, a mutual fund is formed, and an opponent landing on this stock owes increased dividends. On Bull and Bear market spaces, cards are drawn that penalize or reward. Purchasing on margin is allowed.

Contents:

Game Board
7 Denominations of Play Money
20 Bull Cards & 20 Bear Cards
28 Stock Certificates
8 Heavy Metal Playing Pieces
45 Gold Bar Markers
Pair of Dice
Instructions

28974.name: Chav Master
28974.description:
"Put down your Xbox and flush away your Wii because Chav Master has arrived, and times are changing in the world of gaming!"

It’s a new kind of party game where winning can only be achieved by losing, and losing at everything.

Players go head-to-head in a battle of bad behavior, collecting as many A.S.B.O’s (Anti Social Behavior Orders) as they can, in order to prove that they and they alone are worthy of the ultimate Chav Master title, and the Holy Grail of Chavdom - the Golden A.S.B.O!!!

Keep hold of your A.S.B.O’s and your closer to the goal. Lose them and you must hand back your electronic tag, because your out of the game!

Six rounds of classic parlour games get a 21st Century kick up the arse, and 3-12 players take a stroll through the deepest, darkest corners of Chavdom. Only one emerges victorious.

It takes a real loser to win..

Chav Master is a compendium of party games and the contents include:
6 x 'Court Summons' style invitation
6 x 'Electronic Tag' style straps
6 x Classic party games with a 21st Century twist (includes several components including playing cards)
1 x Pack of A.S.B.O's
1 x Golden A.S.B.O.

28975.name: Slots
28975.description: Dice rolling version of one armed bandit machines, gamble against an opponent. Contains 10 slot dice, betting chips, rules and scoring sheets.

28976.name: Laurel and Hardy
28976.description: "A delightfully funny game of monkey business".

28977.name: That Girl
28977.description:
Based on the TV series.
Contents:
Game Board
4 Plastic Bases
4 Player-Figures
34 Games Cards
16 Work Cards
4 Star Boards
1 Die
20 Star Point Segments
Instructions are printed on the inside the box top.

28978.name: Gänse und Blümchen
28978.description:
With Geese and Daisies, Johann Rüttinger provides three games using one set of components, and encourages the players to dream up their own variants.

Geese uses a pre-defined layout of the paths, and is driven by an elementary roll-and-move mechanism. Certain spaces allow a player to go again, while others make the player miss a turn. Reach the goal by an exact roll.

Single-file is a single-pawn-per-player Pachisi variant, using a different pre-defined board layout.

The "title game", Geese and Daisies, uses only the goose tiles and daisy tiles, each type in its own stack. The player rolls the die; if its value matches the number of geese and/or daisies, the player takes the tile(s). The player who gets the most tiles this way wins.

Although the three games suggested are merely pastimes, with no choices for the players, the rules finish up by offering ideas for other games you might wish to invent, using the components.

Selecta Spielzeug 3544

Ages 5 and up

28979.name: Horse-Racing Tycoon
28979.description:
Horse-Racing Tycoon is a boardgame with a horse-racing and betting theme. Players bet on 4 horses and then race them round the track using cards that determine their movement. Made in Hong Kong by a company called 'Playgo', a curious feature is the deck of cards which look remarkably similar to Uno cards, though the play is nothing like Uno at all. Another feature is that the game proclaims proudly (on the box) that it comes with free Playgo money notes.

Advice that appears on the box:
"Be careful, you can gain or lose a fortune in one bet! Never neglect other players' luck!"

28980.description:
The player to first cross the finish line wins. In Advanced play, the driver with the most points after 5 races is the champion.

Roll the die and move a vehicle along the course. Cards that are drawn on the Jump squares penalize or advance the play. Likewise certain squares on the track advance or hinder the race, such as the pit stop which temporarily takes vehicles out of play. Several modifications are suggested in the instructions.

Contents:

Game Board
2 Dice
Deck of Jump Cards
4 Playing Pieces
Rules
28980.name: MotoCross Madness

28981.name: Karafe
28981.description:
From the back of the box:

When you play Karafe, you become the wine maker. You buy your vineyard; harvest your grapes, bottle your wine and sell it. Just open a few bottles of wine and let the party begin. There are over 500 interesting questions or wine taste tests divided into two category levels, so everyone from the sipper to the connoisseur can compete on a level playing field. By the time you play the game just a few times you will impress all of your friends with your knowledge of wine.

Home Page: http://www.karafe.com/

28982.description:
Little Grey Rabbit is a children's card game based on the books by Alison Uttley and "pictured by" Margaret Tempest.

The object of the game is to collect the most counters, which are exchanged with other players according to instructions printed on the cards. Alarmingly, for a children's game, the rules suggest using matches for the counters!

Each player and "Wise Owl" (a dummy hand) are dealt cards which remain face-down. In each round, players reveal their top cards and follow the instructions, giving or taking counters as directed.
28982.name: Little Grey Rabbit

28983.description:
Nobunaga's Greatest Crisis is a game about the campaigns in Samurai Japan from 1570-1582.

This game chronicles the rise of Oda Nobunaga from 1570 to his death in 1582.

The game has 400 counters and 62 cards. The game is area movement, card driven game.

Units represent Samurai lords.
28983.name: Nobunaga's Greatest Crisis

28984.name: Hot Slots
28984.description: A casino dice game that uses 3 dice to simulate 3 rollers of a slot machine. Points are awarded for various combos, and the first player to reach 1000 points wins the game.

28985.name: Drip
28985.description: This is a single stash Icehouse game that also requires the square tube packaging. Players start with a number of pyramids and take turns dropping them into the tube. The first player to drop a pyramid that goes over the edge of the tube will lose. The rules are available for download on the creators website. http://tylertinsley.com/game-desings/

28986.name: Lab Rats
28986.description:
Build a maze and then navigate your rat (pawn), from the start of the maze to its exit, using a limited number of moves. Warning, the layout for this solitaire can take up a lot of table space; this is not one you will be playing on an airplane seat tray.

This game was an entry for the Solitary Confinement contest.

28987.name: Bull in the China Shop
28987.description: Wind the top and drop it in the china shop. Each pin that is knocked over scores points toward winning the game.

28988.name: The Math Game
28988.description:
This is a collection of several games to teach various concepts in math to kids beginning at age 6 (1st grade). It includes a VHS video tape and comes in a big plastic folding box. It begins with addition and subtraction concepts and then goes to simple multiplication and division (including remainders).

It does not look like fun, but probably would be useful in a classroom.

28989.description:
"Garçon" is French for "waiter". It is a card game in which the players hold the role of a waiter in a Café Bar. Their objective is to memorize orders in order to gain the maximum in tips, but in order to carry them it will be necessary to judiciously use the Event Cards, to thwart the plans of the other players and to pay attention to the time which passes.
The game consists of 77 cards and is suited for players Ages 8 and up
28989.name: Garçon
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ20: ¡Camarero! (2007) Alain Ollier

28990.name: Greyhound Race
28990.description: From a description from Alvins Vintage Board Games. This game from a British Manufacturer consists of a small square 12 X 12 board with a little box containing 2 flat tin greyhounds and a rabbit.

28991.name: Halloween Lies
28991.description:
From the publisher's web site:

It's award night and Tom Speed's latest film, The Vampire Detective, has just swept the board and garnered five Skellies - for Best Picture, Best Actor, Best Actress, Best Director and Best Screenplay. Sadly, Tom Speed's award for Best Actor was accepted posthumously by his wife, Zara Vicars, as Tom was killed in a driving accident late last night.

Despite this note of sadness, celebrations are in full swing at the The Vampire Detective post-award party. Deals are being cut for future productions and everyone is having a good time enjoying the atmosphere and mingling with Hollywood's movers and shakers.

Is there anything suspicious about Tom Speed's death? Who will win next year's Skellies? Find out at Halloween Lies.

Halloween Lies lasts for about four hours and is suited to an evening. It is often played over a meal -- a finger buffet if possible to allow guests to circulate and talk in private.

Home Page: http://www.freeformgames.com/game_details.php?31

28992.name: Under the Big Top
28992.description:
From the publisher's web site:

It's 1952 and Bo Bennett's Big Top Bonanza has reached Sarasota, Florida for their final show. With a successful nine month tour behind them, the performers and staff of the Bonanza are making plans for a restful and rewarding off-season.

As the curtain falls on the final Big Top performance, a select few gather in JoJo Bones' Exotic Emporium of Enigmatica (part of the Bonanza). To celebrate the successful tour, JoJo will host a night of revelry, food, drink and, this year, what JoJo has promised to be "startling revelations." Tragically, however, JoJo was killed last night. His body was found early this morning in the lions' cage, mauled by lions Gladys and Mountjoy. Since JoJo's body reeked of alcohol, preliminary reports are that he wandered into the cage in a drunken stupor.

But, the show must go on and the post-season party will continue - and so the selected performers and staff of Bo Bennett's Big Top Bonanza assemble to remember JoJo and celebrate the successful season. This may be their last chance to seal their fates for the future...

Under the Big Top lasts for about four hours and is suited to an evening. It is often played over a meal -- a finger buffet if possible to allow guests to circulate and talk in private.

Home Page: http://www.freeformgames.com/game_details.php?22

28993.name: 1650 more Questions & Answers for use with Trivial Pursuit: Set I, Group IV
28993.description:
From the Back of the Box:

1650 more Questions & Answers for use with Trivial Pursuit...

Happy triviaphiles will recognize the Q&A's in this set from Set I of the award-winning Game of Trivia by the Avalon Hill Game company.

Now - we make these same questions & answers available for devotees of Trivial Pursuit, without having you pay for a complete game.

Here - in this box - are 1,650 additional Q&A's, color-coded for play with Trivial Pursuit (and other similar games of trivia).

And... if 1,650 of them aren't enough, check out the additional groups - labeled 1 thru 4 - to complete the set of 6,600 additional questions and answers.

OMNI Magazine - December '84 - selected Game of Trivia by The Avalon Hill Game Company... "best trivia game of the year, based on its variety of questions and low ratio of arguable answers."

GAMES Magazine - September '84 - editors' choice for GAMES 100 because... "Game of Trivia plays more like a true board game, and there's no reason why you can't use the questions for Trivial Pursuit."

28994.description:
From the Back of the Box:

1650 more Questions & Answers for use with Trivial Pursuit...

Happy triviaphiles will recognize the Q&A's in this set from Set I of the award-winning Game of Trivia by the Avalon Hill Game company.

Now - we make these same questions & answers available for devotees of Trivial Pursuit, without having you pay for a complete game.

Here - in this box - are 1,650 additional Q&A's, color-coded for play with Trivial Pursuit (and other similar games of trivia).

And... if 1,650 of them aren't enough, check out the additional groups - labeled 1 thru 4 - to complete the set of 6,600 additional questions and answers.

OMNI Magazine - December '84 - selected Game of Trivia by The Avalon Hill Game Company... "best trivia game of the year, based on its variety of questions and low ratio of arguable answers."

GAMES Magazine - September '84 - editors' choice for GAMES 100 because... "Game of Trivia plays more like a true board game, and there's no reason why you can't use the questions for Trivial Pursuit."
28994.name: 1650 more Questions & Answers for use with Trivial Pursuit: Set I, Group III

28995.name: The World Almanac for Kids Game
28995.description:
The World Almanac for Kids Game will test your brain power with multiple choice questions specifically written for kids. This is a family fun game full of useful facts.
Be amazed at what you know! Make learning fun. Impress your friends. Stump your family. Have a ball discovering the world around you.
Test Your Brain Power with multiple choice questions specially written
for kids. A wide range of topics from animals to world history and everything in between, you will be fascinate for hours.

28996.name: The Great Mosque Game
28996.description:
A fun way to learn about mosques!

To help children learn, in an enjoyable way, about the basics of mosque architecture and layout, this unique questions and answers game provides a wealth of interesting information on all the world's most important mosques. Special emphasis is laid on the Kabah and Islam's most sacred cities of Makkah, Madinah, and Jerusalem. By answering the questions on these subjects, the player will also acquire a knowledge of such Islamic practices as salah, hajj, etc.

Each of the four categories in this game has 100 questions with multiple-choice answers. An attractive feature is the illustrations accompanying many of the questions, which make it easy for children to find the correct answers.

The major appeal of the game is that it offers wholesome entertainment along with the opportunity to imbibe Islamic teachings in a simple, natural and fun-filled way.

Teaches about :

Sacred Mosques in Islam
Famous mosques around the world
Mosque architecture
The teachings of Islam about the mosque (masjid), salah (daily prayer), and Hajj (sacred pilgrimage)

More info here...
http://onlineislamicstore.com/a4425.html

28997.name: The Hajj Fun Game
28997.description:
The Hajj Fun Game offers you entertainment and fun and at the same time makes it easy for you to learn the meaning and message of Hajj. It helps you to acquire a knowledge of the important historical places associated with it. It will enable you to learn how the acts and rites are performed during Hajj, and what its do's and don'ts are. In short, the Hajj Fun Game will bring alive the annual pilgrimage of Hajj.

Ages 8 and up

More info at
http://onlineislamicstore.com/a4529.html

28998.name: Hadith Challenge Game
28998.description:
This product is a unique game based on the Hadith (sayings, traditions) of the Holy Prophet Muhammed (pbuh). The idea behind the game is to provide children with both a fun and educational tool. All questions are taken directly from the Hadith, and have been creatively worked into the play, which kids will enjoy answering. It can be played at school or at home, with friends and family members. Begin the journey and find out what fun it is to learn from the sayings of the Prophet!

More info here
http://onlineislamicstore.com/a4746.html

28999.name: Know Islam Know Peace Board Game
28999.description:
This game is easy to learn and simple to play. Each player or team selects one of the yellow game boards. One player identified as the "caller" selects a blue information card and reads the Islamic term or name at the top. Players that have the word on their boards are asked to define or describe the importance of the Islamic practice, person or event. If they do so correctly, they receive a chip to cover the word. The object is to be the 1st player to fill a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal line. There can be numerous variations to the standard play to accommodate different age groups or to emphasize English or Arabic language skills.

More info here...
http://onlineislamicstore.com/a4437.html

29000.name: Game of Knowledge: Spirit of Islam
29000.description:
This board game originated in India some time before the 18th century. There were many versions, each based on different belief systems. This Muslim version is known as the Game of Knowledge. It teaches the player about Islam.

The player of this game embarks on a journey during which he will learn that the upward path of the spiritual seeker is a gradual one. The game starts at the left of the bottom row on the square inscribed Adam, and continues across each successive row to the top row inscribed with the names of the archangels. Each square is filled with an inscription describing one of a hundred different states of man.

More information here...

http://www.moa.ubc.ca/spiritofislam/knowledge/game_of_knowle...

28501.name: Irishopoly
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
28501.description:
Designed for the University of Notre Dame. Made by Late For The Sky Production Company.

COMPLETE contents include: 1 game board, 5 tokens, 2 dice, years of credit cards, diplomas, campus mail and contingency cards, property deeds, play money , instructions and original plastic insert.

28502.name: Huey, Dewey, and Louie
28502.description:
The Ice Cream Cone Game.

Made by Western Publishing in 1977 for 2-4 players Ages 7 - 12.

OBJECT: Be the first players to get an ice cream cone from the ice cream shop to Donald and Daisy.

COMPLETE contents include: 12 playing pieces, spinner, game board, and the instructions printed on the inside of the box top.

28503.name: Hey Diddle Diddle
28503.description:
A happy game for 2-4 players Ages 4 and up. No reading required!

Made by Colorforms in 1981.

OBJECT: Travel along the starry trail, jump over the moon, and be the first player to arrive home.

COMPLETE contents include: platform game board, spinner, 4 colorful cows, 4 wooden sticks, and the instructions printed on the box top.

28504.description:
A campaign pack for 5th edition Warhammer, Perilous Quest introduces a linked series of scenarios featuring the Bretonnian and Wood Elf armies.

Extra rules and special characters are introduced in the campaign pack. Box contents consist of the campaign rulebook; 4 battle scrolls for each player and card buildings used in the scenarios. The card buildings consist of tents and a tourney area plus a wagon for which four plastic wheels are included.
Also a Roster Pad for Warhammer is included.
28504.name: Warhammer Perilous Quest

28505.name: Tricky
28505.description:
Simple Trick taking game with a nice twist: You don't have the cards on the hands but they are on the table on 4 face-up piles. So you have to play the upper cards to get to the lower ones.
Also you can play several cards at once, adding their value up but with the risk of running out of cards before the end of the round

28507.name: Ryskland
28507.description: This is basically Risk using the United States, instead of the world, as a map. There are 51 territories (the states and the District of Columbia) in which to place the four colors of plastic chips (each representing "an army of 1,000 soldiers). Set-up, by alternate picking of territories, and die roll combat is identical to Risk. The came contains 153 cards (infantry, cavalry, and "governor" cards for each of the 51 territories), and card play is significantly different from Risk, as a card from a stack of shuffled infantry and cavalry cards is picked every time a territory is conquered. If a player acquires both the infantry and cavalry cards for a state, the player is awarded the governor card for that state and immediately takes that state over. If another player has the other card, there is a one-die showdown to determine control. Play continues until all 102 infantry/cavalry cards are drawn, and the winner is the player with the most territories at that time. The game is well-made, with front & back box printing, a mounted board, plastic insert, 153 cards, 6 dice, 4 sets of 64 plastic chips, and three rules booklets (English, Spanish, French).

28508.name: Loaded Questions: Adult Version
28508.description: Get ready for fun questions, ridiculous answers and nonstop laughter as you and your friends take turns guessing which player wrote which answer while writing your own personal answers to suggestive, silly, and stimulating questions. The ADULT version of the best-selling Loaded Questions is more than suggestive, more than funny, and (from both laughter and embarrassment) just might make your cheeks as red as the cover of the box!

28509.name: Scene It? TV  Deluxe Edition
28509.description:
From the publisher:

TV trivia at its best!
With 50 years of TV packed into two DVDs, the Deluxe TV Edition of Scene It? is the quintessential television trivia game. From The Brady Bunch to Alias this game will keep players tuned in for hours and hours of TV entertainment.

28510.name: Scene It? Friends Deluxe Edition
28510.description:
From the publisher:

Double your Friends fun with 2 DVDs!
From Marcel the Monkey and Smelly Cat to foosball and Ugly Naked Guy, you'll relive all your favorite moments from all your favorite episodes, through real show clips, trivia questions and an array of on-screen puzzlers compiled from all ten seasons of the hit show Friends.

Deluxe Edition Game Includes:

Collectible Tin
2 DVDs (includes bonus DVD)
Flextime® Game Board
Party Play
6 Collectible Metal Tokens (2 extra Tokens)
200 Trivia Cards (25% more Trivia Cards)
30 Buzz Cards
4 Reference Cards
1 Six-Sided Die
1 Eight-Sided Die

28511.name: Scene it? Disney Deluxe Edition
28511.description:
From the publisher:

Now available in a distinctive game tin, Scene It? Deluxe Disney Edition offers more clips and characters from your favorite Disney and Pixar movies, more trivia questions and more on-screen challenges than ever before. A true family game, Scene It? Deluxe Disney Edition comes with separate trivia cards for adults and kids and a second game disc, featuring a unique Party Play setting, voiced by Christy Carlson Romano (Kim Possible, Even Stevens), who reads the questions and answers aloud for younger players to enjoy on their own.

Deluxe Edition Game Includes:

Collectible Tin
2 DVDs (includes bonus DVD)
Flextime® Game Board
Party Play
6 Collectible Metal Tokens (2 extra Tokens)
200 Trivia Cards (25% more Trivia Cards)
30 Buzz Cards
4 Reference Cards
1 Six-Sided Die
1 Eight-Sided Die
Set of Game Rules

28512.name: Battle Dot 1
28512.description: This game for Ages 4 and up and up helps them learn beginning math concepts like counting on. It plays similar to war, but instead of a standard playing card deck, each card shows a small sum represented by dots of different colors. Children lay down cards, then determine if they've won the hand by adding the sums. Comes with 24 large cards.

28513.name: Mr. Game
28513.description: Mr Game is a self contained game module system that contains the parts, boards and instructions to play 20 games: Baseball Bagatelle, Beat The Banker, Buck Dice, Checkers, Eight By Eight, Fox and Geese, Happy Face Puzzle, Help Your Neighbor, Hoop-La, Hoses and Ladders, Morris The Farmer, Parchisi, Queen Bee, Ship Captain Mate and Crew, Shuffleboard, Solitaire, Spin A Winner, Steeplechase, Tic-Tac-Toe, and Tiddly Winks. The central Mr Game figure is used in many of these games, making standard games unique to Mr Game (for example, one of his arms shoots the shuffleboard disks and the balls for Baseball Bagatelle). Designed and play tested with target audience of Ages 5 and up

28514.name: 'Eye Jinxx
28514.description:
From the Introduction to the Rules:
"Eye Jinxx, the jigsaw puzzle board game, can be enjoyed several ways.
It can be assembled cooperatively, by one or more persons, without rules or time constraints.
It can be assembled competitively, by two or more players/teams, in accordance with the rules, time limits, and scoring format provided. We recommend a maximum of FOUR teams, with no more than SIX players per team.
Also, whether playing cooperatively or competitively, there is the ongoing challenge of locating the eight hidden objects.
We recommend that prior to playing the game, the puzzle be assembled and the hidden objects be located."
Components include jigsaw puzzle pieces, game board, D6 die, 4 pencils, 3 minute sand timer, score pad, and 4 hidden object cards.
NGC 404
Copyright 1990 by Strathcona Mosaic Limited.

28515.name: PGA Tour Finger Golf
28515.description: Played on a high gloss durable mat that measures 2 feet by 4 feet, players flick a ringed ball-bearing towards the hole in a game that simulates the game of golf.

28516.name: Finger Baseball
28516.description: The game of baseball now in finger form. One player pitches and the other bats. The pitch starts by flicking the marker towards home plate. Based upon where it lands the result could be a ball, strike, pending hit, or a player choices. If it's a pending hit, then the batter must flick the marker and land on the corresponding "hit" location, otherwise it's an out.

28517.name: Problemas de Diccionario
28517.description:
This is a word meaning game with some particularities:
1.- It has card with STRANGE words, so they are very difficult and, because not a lot people know their meaning, allows to bluff and laugh a lot.
2.- Players start in the ignorance gear and must go until the knowledge gear.
3.- Each player has it’s own path on the board.
4.- Each path is different because contains different icons, that allows you to get bonus points if the image on the gear you are on mach the one in the card being played.

As with all this kind of games, players must give the meaning of the word that appears in a card. In they don’t know it they must bluff, so he can convince the other players that his meaning is the right one. Each time they get a vote, he advance in the board until one of them reaches the knowledge gear.

28518.name: Intense Bridge
28518.description:
A published Bridge variant.
It uses Jill cards to allow the declarer to call "his" or "hers".
HIS ranks: A K Q Jack Jill 10 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2
HER ranks: A Q K Jill Jack 10 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2
A few other rules change this game from the standard Bridge game.

28519.name: Thrilling Tales of Adventure!
28519.description:
Thrilling Tales of Adventure! is set in the world of pulp fiction and adventure serials of the 1920s and 1930s. One player, the Arch Villain, attempts to build and execute dastardly plots while the remaining players -- each of whom assumes the role of a classic pulp hero -- try to foil these plots. Among the 10 heroes to choose from are Samantha Starr (intrepid girl reporter) the Amazing Uri (former magician to the Tsar), and the Blue Falcon (ace aviatrix). The game plays out over three Acts, as the Arch Villain works toward the execution of a final Master Plan, such as the construction and activation of a massive death ray, or encasing the world in ice for all eternity.

The key mechanic of the game is the creation of "Adventures," linked sets of cards that the Heroes must investigate and overcome in order to collect Heroism points. There are two types of Adventures: "Wild Adventures," which are generated on the fly by a combination of card plays and draws from the various decks; and "Plots," which are custom-built by the Arch Villain player and have much higher stakes.

28520.name: Stopp!
28520.description: This game is basically a copy of the Hasbro-Game "Taboo": You explain words to your team members and try to avoid certain "Stopp-Words". Main difference: The explanation time is much shorter and you are only allowed to explain 1 card.

28521.name: I Doubt It
28521.description: The game is played with 5 dice that are marked like playing cards. They have values: 9, 10, J, Q, K, A. One player puts the dice in the box and shakes to randomize. The player then looks at the dice without revealing their value to the other players. The player who "rolled" states a value for the dice which may be true or false. The other players must decide if they want to believe or doubt the value of the dice.

28522.name: Finger Ball
28522.description:
Finger Ball**



Two players. Each player reveals 1,2 or 3 fingers from his or her hand, rock-paper-scissors style.

If a player reveals exactly two more fingers than his opponent, then he scores a touchdown (7 pts)

If a player reveals exactly one less finger than his opponent, then he scores a field goal (3 pts)

If both players reveal the same number, the quarter ends.

Most points after four completed quarters wins.

Examples:
Herman reveals 1 finger
Jorge reveals 3 fingers
JORGE SCORES A TOUCHDOWN (7 pts)

Herman reveals 1 finger
Jorge reveals 2 fingers
HERMAN SCORES A FIELD GOAL (3 pts)

28523.name: Leap-in-a-Line
28523.description:
This is a childrens game that is based on Connect Four. The box contains a school bus shaped board, an alphabet road, 106 tokens and an instruction book. The tokens are divided into four different colors. Each color of token has a different picture set. These sets include shapes of various sizes and colors, letters with both uppercase and lowercase of various colors and pictures of different items with the word written on it(ex. a picture of a dog with the word dog written on it).

The different tokens allow the same board to be used for five different learning games.

boardgamehonor: 2008 Boardgames Australia Awards Best Children's Game Nominee
28524.description:
Part Bingo, part Memory. Be the first to complete your Bingo card by collecting matching pairs and you win. Contents: 16 wooden matching pairs, 4 wooden Bingo cards, and a cotton pouch.

For Ages 4 and up.
28524.name: Bingory

28525.name: 3 in 1 Table-Top Sports
28525.description:
From the box:

CALLING ALL TABLETOP SPORTS FANS!

Flex your fingers and get ready to flick! Inside this cool package you'll find everything you need to play tabletop soccer, hockey, AND football!


26 punch-out pieces for players, ballsa, and pucks!
Two sturdy goalposts!
Stickers!
Dozens of game rules, flick tips, and more!


From the rulebook:

When's the last time you played a game of soccer, hockey and football...on the kitchen table? Get set to flex your fingers and challenge your friends! Use this book to score your way into the tabletop sports history books...

INCLUDES:


Amazing finger flick techniques!
Team uniform tips!
Tabletop game rules!
Scoring strategies!
Plus! Other fast moves and quick tricks!

28526.name: Two Up
28526.description:
One of Australia's many contributions to the world of gambling. The game is conducted in a flat circle of approximately 20 feet (6 metres) or larger. The only equipment required (aside from materials for tracking bets) is two coins (by tradition pre-decimal pennies), and a flat piece of wood called the "kip" approximately 8 inches in length which has holes carved in it to fit the coins neatly but loosely enough for the coins to come out when tossed.

The game is run by a "boxer", who calls the first "potato" (one of the players around the circle) in to toss the coins. The spinner wagers an amount of their choice on either "heads" or "tails". Other players around the ring can then also bet on either "heads" or "tails". .

Once all bets are taken, the boxer calls "no more bets", and the player tosses the coins in the air using the kip. To be a valid throw, they must go above the head height of the spinner, be rotating sufficiently and land entirely in the ring - if they do not the boxer calls "barred" and the throw is retaken. Ideally the call must occur before the coins settle.

If the coins land both on the same face, the round ends and non-spinning player's bets are paid off, with people who bet on the same face as that landed winning. A new round of non-spinner bets is then taken before the spinner throws again.

If the coins come up with one tail and one head, the spinner spins again. If 5 "odds" come up, all players lose and a new spinner is selected.

If the spinner throws his nominated face three times before either 5 "odds" being thrown in a row, or a spin with both coins being the opposite face, the spinner wins and is paid at 7.5 to 1 (in most modern games).

28527.description:
Odd is a simple abstract game for 2 players, with stones of 2 colors, typically played on a hexagonally tiled board with 5 cells on each edge (though it can be played on almost any tiling). Odd can also be played with pencil and paper.

Definitions:

A group is a set of stones on the board, all of the same color, for which it is possible to trace a continuous path between any two of them by stepping between adjacent stones of that color.
The size of a group is the number of stones in it.




Rules:

The board begins empty.
Players take turns. On each turn a player places one stone of either color onto any empty space.
The game ends when the board is full. Player 1 wins if there is an odd number of groups of at least size 5 on the board, and Player 2 wins otherwise. When counting groups, be sure add up the total number of connected groups of both colors.




Notes:

One can change the character of the game by increasing or decreasing the minimum size which a group must have in order to be counted at the end. The larger the minimum group size, the more strategic and less tactical the game becomes, and vice-versa
28527.name: Odd

28528.name: Oz Quiz 2000
28528.description:
The updated version of 1984's Oz Quiz.
The crazy, zany around-Australia trivia game.
Over 2000 questions. Comes packaged in an esky as per the original.

28529.name: My First Card Games
28529.description:
This is children’s game that contains rules and card sets for Math Rummy and Alphabet Go Fish. Also included in the box are four children’s card holders to allow young children hold a hand of cards.

The Math Rummy game has 24 cards that contain number cards (1-10) and plus cards, minus cards and a board to create simple equations. The Math Rummy rules contain the rules for two games of various difficulties as well as teach-me tips on using this game with children.

The Alphabet Go Fish game has 78 cards, three of each letter with a representative item for that letter on the card (ex. key for k). The cards are also in six different colors to allow for color matching games. The Alphabet Go Fish rules contain the rules for three games of various difficulty as well as teach-me tips on using this game with children.

28530.name: Omniana
28530.description:
Omniana is a fantasy card game in which players use their imagination to creatively debate battles between many strange & absurd characters in a multitude of exotic & normal locations.
On each Character Card there is a brief description of an original character detailing his special abilities, weaknesses and history. Players take turns sending one of their characters into an opponent's situation to battle against that opponent's pre-selected character. One or more of the remaining players will judge each battle. Using only the information on their cards, both of the battling players must argue how and why his character would win in a duel. The judge(s) decides the victor and awards him either a treasure or an advantage card. The player with the most treasure at the end of the game wins.

Home Page: http://www.omnianathegame.com

28532.name: Sonny the Seal
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel at Essen 2011 - Goliath Games
28532.description:
"Clapping, Barking, Bobbing, and Tipping - the motorized hoopla game!"

Toss rings around the neck of a motorized seal as it bobs around and makes seal noises.

28535.description:
From the manufacturer's web site:

Join Pooh, Piglet, Eeyore and Tigger for a most exciting adventure. Collect everything on your list. Everyone wins!
Several ways to play for different skill levels. Features chunky cards for small hands.

Develops shape and color recognition, counting skills and cooperative play.

For Ages 3 and up.
28535.name: Pooh Scavenger Hunt Game

28536.name: Do You Sudoku? Game for Kids
28536.description:
To play, players roll the die, make the sound of the animal on the die, then try to place that animal on their grid. This is a kids version of Do You Sudoku? that involves 6 animals pictures on a 6 X 6 grid instead of the numbers 1 - 9 on a 9 X 9 grid.

From the publisher's web site:
Find a Home for Every Animal on the Farm!

Oink! Moo! Baa! Our Do you Sudoku? Game for Kids brings the logic solving challenge of Sudoku puzzles together with cute farm animals. Here's a fun way for children and parents to play together while developing patterning and logic skills.

Players roll a die, make the noise of their favorite animals and try to place the animal tile onto the correct space.

The Rules Are Simple
No animal can appear twice in the same 6 square box or in a line up and down or in a line across.

Contains 30 puzzle cards (60 puzzles), 108 animal tiles and 1 die.

Ages 6 & up.

28537.name: Yale-Princeton Football Game
28537.description: Large, colorful football themed boardgame with beautiful graphics. Comes with wooden play pieces and spinners.

28538.name: Monopoly: Indianapolis Colts Super Bowl XLI Champions Commemorative
28538.description:
The Colts Super Bowl XLI Champions Edition of the Monopoly game is the only game that allows Colts fans the opportunity to buy, sell and trade the greatest players and coaches from the Super Bowl XLI Champion Colts in an effort to control their favorite team. Bankrupt your opponents and own it all. A must have for all Colts fans!
